column1: starts off with a back of a length ball from around the wicket, angled in but fired from wide of the crease, Dhawan shuffles across slightly and shoulders arms
a lot fuller and closer to off-stump as well. Dhawan trusts the angle and is sure of his off-stump and lets it go
full, too wide outside off and moves it very, very late, left alone by the batsman
short of good length, finally bowls a line that makes the batsman play, Dhawan defends in front of off from the backfoot into the covers region
switches back to the older line, fullish which is right, but not close enough to make the batsman play

edged and through the cordon. This is what the bowler was looking for all over, and when he finally gets the outside edge, it evades everyone in the cordon. Goes wide of the third slip who gets down to his left, between him and gully as Dhawan pushed forward hard to one that angled away
Rahul pushes forward to a loopy fuller ball on middle and ekes out an inside edge that goes past the right of forward short leg
loopy tossed up ball on off, Rahul comes forward and pushes it out to point
another outside edge, does not carry to first slip. Sticks the bat out and opens the face but he went at it with soft hands so it falls short of Mathews
shifts back to this back of a length ball and punches it out to the region between cover and point

what a response from the batsman! Just a little bit of flight from Herath and Dhawan springs down the track before lofting him with the turn for a huge six over long-on. Got right on top of that and timed it beautifully
fuller ball outside off, comes forward and eases it down to the mid-on region for a quiet single
pitched up wide outside off, swings away further, finishes wider than a set of stumps outside off. Dhawan shows restraint and lets it pass
good length and angled back in, much closer to off, but it does not threaten it. Dhawan ignores again
Pradeep drags his length back. Dug in shorter and outside off, Dhawan shifts his balance onto the back foot and punches the ball to cover
on a length and just outside off - not short enough for a cut though the width was there for the shot - the ball keeps a bit low and beats the cut
shorter and outside off, Dhawan succeeds in cutting it away in the gap between gully and backward point. Dhawan leans back and times it sweetly to the boundary
shortish and on a fourth-stump line, Dhawan does not have enough width to work with. He jabs this one straight to backward point
Herath undercuts this one. Tossed up and slides on on a fourth-stump line, well-judged leave from Rahul
Rahul is itchy. He uses his feet to this looped-up ball, he does not meet the pitch. Prods it to short leg
full on middle, played back to the bowler
slightly shorter and wider outside off, Rahul skips back and cuts it away... Dhananjaya flings himself to his left to stop the ball
full on off, Rahul opens the face and defensively drops it towards backward point
faster and flatter on off, low-arm fizzer, Rahul hurriedly blocks it towards mid-on
back of a length and holds its line outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, Dhawan walks across off but miscues a punch to cover. Wanders away off the toe end
Pradeep tests Dhawan with a chest-high bouncer outside off. This isn't a quick surface. Dhawan has ample time to swivel back and pull it away to the square leg boundary
good length and angled in on off, quicker at 140.3ks, presses forward and pushes to mid-on
Dhawan has crunched it to short cover. Half-volley outside off, Dhawan leans into it and punchily drives it to the fielder. Chandimal dives to his right to partially stop the ball
pretty full and slanted into Rahul from wide of the crease. The opener plays all around his front pad and squirts an inside edge, weathering the lbw appeal
full and straight, Dhawan eases it down to long-on, who is in the deep at the start of the sixth over
looped up on off, no turn, Rahul responds with a dead bat
flatter on off stump, Rahul goes back and whisks it to short leg
hung up in the air, dips on middle, Rahul defends it onto the pitch
round-arm slider, width outside off. This wasn't all that short but Rahul brings out the cut and hits it to the right of backward point

goes right through mid-off! Rahul dances down the track, takes it on the full and drives it down the ground. He fetches a boundary with some assistance from Dimuth who stumbles and lets the ball away to the boundary
length ball outside off, Dhawan takes it on the up and creams a drive through extra cover. Away she whistles to the boundary
dig in shorter and outside off, blocked to point
back of a length and outside off, angles his bat and chops it down to gully
shorter and outside off, Dhawan jumps off the ground and plays a back-foot punch to cover
a bit too full and outside off, Dhawan leans into a drive and caresses it past the right of mid-off
Pradeep mounts an appeal for lbw, but this seems to be heading down leg with the sharp angle from around the wicket. This was very full and slanted in on middle and leg, catches Dhawan on the shuffle
back of a length and floated on off, punchily played back to the bowler
good length on off, 112ks, Rahul camps back and defends it back to Karunaratne
just short of a good length and outside off, Rahul stands up tall and crisply punches it to the right of sweeper cover for three
back of a length and floated into the pads, 115ks, swings in a touch, beats Dhawan's attempt to flick it away
full and wide outside off, Dhawan leans into a drive and sends it to the off-side sweeper
good length and on a fourth-stump line, Rahul gets right behind the line in defence
full and angling away outside off, no shot
Bang! Good length and wide outside off, Dhawan has a confident stride, drives it on the up past short cover. Has he already deflated Sri Lanka?
chest-high short ball on middle, but Pradeep does not have enough pace on this to harry Dhawan. 131ks, he rolls his wrists and controls a pull to deep square leg
Pradeep strays on the pads, all Rahul needed was to get a scrape of bat on it. He does it, tickling it very fine of long leg. India motor past 50 in the ninth over
tighter on off, Rahul opens the face and guides it through cover-point
overpitched on off, Dhawan hangs back and drills a drive to mid-off

Karunaratne has Rahul lbw. Impact in line, and he is smacked on the front pad above the knee-roll. Height may be an issue, and Rahul chooses to challenge the on-field out decision from Oxenford. Good length, starts outside off, and swings back into Rahul. He plays around his front pad and is rapped on the flap. The tracker suggests it was heading down leg and bouncing too much as well. Karunaratne has to wait for his maiden Test wicket
back of a length on middle, keeps back and punches it to mid-on
whipped off the pads through square leg
back of a length and slanting away outside off, punched on the up to sweeper
back of a length and swinging in on middle again, Rahul hangs back, plays all around it. He ekes out an inside edge behind square
back of a length and outside off, eased to sweeper on the front foot

and he strikes the front pad right away! Did it straighten enough? Umpire Tucker doesn't think so. Dilruwan and Chandimal go for a review. Pushed through on middle from around the wicket, Dhawan dares to sweep from the stumps. He deploys a big stride but does not make contact. He is pinned on the pad in front of middle and leg. The tracker shows it would have carried onto hit leg. All three reds, and Dhawan is gone
tossed outside off, Pujara stretches out, opens the face, and runs it behind point to get off the mark
tossed full on off, Rahul prefers to play back and defend to cover
skids on short and outside off, Rahul is beaten on the cut. He lost his shape there
offbreak, spinning into the pads, clipped with the break to long leg
straight ball on off, Pujara has a big stride in defence. Played back to the bowler
pushed on a good length and outside off, Rahul's bat-face turns on impact as he forces an inside edge back to the bowler
back of a length and angled in on off, Rahul plays across the line and dribbles a leading edge to cover
full and wobbles in on middle and leg, Rahul plays back again, blocking to midwicket
good length and outside off, Rahul now presses forward and solidly pushes it to mid-off
picked off the pads through the vacant spaces at midwicket. Two is the call from Rahul and he gets it
just short of a good length on middle, Rahul jumps back and punchily plays the ball to midwicket

Dilruwan draws an outside edge from Pujara with his first ball of the second over. It just dies in front of Mathews. Slides on with the arm outside off, Pujara wafts at it, and nicks it. Mathews dives to his right but it drops short
a mix-up between the wickets now! On a length and outside off, tapped into the gap at the covers. India have enough time to recover and complete the single
swept from the stumps to long leg
Pujara skips down the track and drives a full ball from outside off to mid-off
tossed up wide outside off, the ball isn't turning that much, Pujara simply kicks it away with his pad
Pujara forays down the track again, meets the pitch of this half-volley, and drives it firmly to mid-on
slides in with the arm, flat and quick, hastily jabbed to midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, down the track and driven to short midwicket. The fielder flings himself to his left to stop the ball
tossed up on middle and leg, thrusts the bat in front of the pad and blocks
slower through the air on off, non-turner, Pujara presses forward and smothers it
round-armish ball. Floated up on middle, dead-batted
full on off, Pujara presses out and defends it solidly
flat offbreak, straying into the pads, whipped to midwicket on the back foot
Pujara runs down the track, pushes to mid-on, and puts his hand up to the partner
short and just a shade outside off, Pujara jumps back, gets on top of the bounce and square-cuts it away for two
Pujara dashes down the track again. This is looped up just a shade outside off, he meets the pitch, and drills a drive past the right of the bowler
excellent footwork again. Anticipates a short ball outside off, jumps back, and cracks it straight to backward point now
lobbed up wide outside off, Pujara pads up to it, knowing it isn't breaking back enough to hit off
shot! Flighted on middle, hint of risk involved but the ball isn't turning that much for Pushpakumara. Rahul steps away outside leg, and drives it inside-out over extra cover
Rahul continues to attack the debutant. He charges out and smashes this right back to the bowler, who dives to his right and takes some pace off the ball
here comes the paddle-sweep. Lapped away to long leg
flighted on middle, Pujara now skips out and drives it straight to mid-on
slower through the air and angled in on middle, Pujara defends with soft hands
full on middle and leg, down the track and clipped away past the right of midwicket
tossed up liberally outside off, Rahul presses out and drives smoothly through cover point
drifts in on off, presses out and squirts an inside edge onto the pad
down the track and worked defensively to midwicket
Pujara steps out again, this is flicked past the left of a tumbling short midwicket
flatter and faster outside off, skips back and punches straight to cover
slower through the air, dips on middle, Pujara blocks with a straight bat
slides in with the arm on off, defended back off the back foot
short on, spins away, but the length allows Rahul to defend off the back foot again
much fuller and angled in on middle and leg, Rahul has a short stride as he blocks it to short leg
Rahul walks out, but this ball dips in front of him, he adjusts and pushes it back
full and straight on off and middle, pushed back to Pushpakumara
fractionally short on off stump, Rahul picks the length quickly. He ventures deep in the crease and pulls it over midwicket
drifts in and breaks away slightly, Pujara pokes but does not thrust his hands out. The outside edge rolls towards point
short and spins away outside off, slashed to point. Pujara  takes the fielder on and  scampers across for the single
non-turner, left alone outside off
dangled up on off stump, Rahul stretches out, rolls his wrists, and sweeps it hard to the left of forward short leg and right of midwicket. Yes, it's risky but the execution was excellent
clipped with the angle into the vacant spaces at midwicket
tossed up on off, Pujara presses forward and defends it past the left of short leg
drifting into the pads, tickled fine on the leg side
dangled up on off, Pujara presses forward and smothers it
shorter and darted into the pads, hurriedly blocked on the bounce to short leg
drifting into leg, Pujara unfurls the sweep. Short leg takes a blow and intercepts the ball
Pujara hits Mendis at short leg again! He is struck on the helmet. Short on middle, Pujara reads the length, jumps back, and smacks the grille of the helmet. The ball nearly balloons to midwicket
Pujara gallops down the track, gets too close to the pitch of this full one outside off, and ends up jabbing it away
skids on outside off, Rahul opens the face and punches to point
tossed on off, opens the face and guides it to cover-point
keeps lobbing it up on off, but finds no turn, negotiated with an open face
slower through the air, drifting in on middle and leg, inside-edged in front of short leg
Herath finds turn but the length is short and the line is wider. Forced through point

that's a beauty from Herath! Opens him Pujara and zips past the outside edge. Full, drifts in from wide of the crease, Pujara plays for the angle, but the ball breaks away cunningly. The ball of the morning so far
back of a length and angled in on middle, nudged to midwicket
very full and angled down leg, past the glance
just short of a good length and outside off, a jabbing punch to mid-off ensures
back of a length and wide outside off, Rahul's front foot does not meet the pitch. He thrusts his hands out and drags an inside edge behind square
Rahul gets on top of a short ball on off and blocks to cover
good length on middle and leg, Rahul shuffles across off stump and pats it down to mid-on
fractionally short on off, Pujara rocks back and pulls, Mendis at short leg cops another blow
short and wide outside off, Pujara slashes a cut to cover
nurdled with the angle to the right of short leg
Pujara presses out now and defends it past the left of short leg
tossed up on the leg stump, deflected to backward square leg
really full on middle, Pujara answers with a dead bat
short and width outside off, stands tall and forces it to cover
bouncer outside off, ducks under it
good length and outside off, no shot
back of a length and straying into the thighs, tucked around the corner
dug short and wide outside off, Rahul has a leaden-footed flash and inside-edges it to cover
really full on middle and leg, clipped away to square leg
flighted on off, Rahul bends forward in defence
Rahul surges down the track, gets too close to the pitch to time it well enough. Ends up jabbing it to mid-off, where Dimuth fumbles
pushed through on off, defended with an angled bat
tossed up on middle, Pujara thrusts his bat in front of the pad in defence
drifts into the pads, Pujara presses out, prods and squirts an inside edge onto the pad. The ball lobs to the right of a diving Mendis at short leg
fuller on middle, defended
good length and swerves in on off, takes the inside edge and trickles into the vacant spaces at square leg
good length on middle, closes the face, and pushes it to square leg
just short of a good length on off, blocked to midwicket
full on middle and leg, tapped to the right of mid-on
back of a length and skids back into Pujara to beat the inside edge and smack the thigh
wide of the crease, angled in, Pujara defends off the inside half to mid-on
tossed on middle and leg, presses forward and blocks it to short leg
length ball on off, twirls away, defended on the back foot
dangled up very wide outside off, Rahul does not go after it

This is another top ball from Herath. An appeal for stumping sent to the TV umpire. Rahul, though, keeps his back leg grounded. He survives. Good length ball, much faster and flatter, drifts in on off stump, drags Rahul forward and breaks away. He dares to flick against the turn and the ball shoots past the leading edge. But Rahul's back leg went nowhere. The ball wasn't too far away from hitting the off stump either

shot. What a way to bring up a sixth successive fifty! This nearly goes all the way. Tossed up outside off, Rahul makes room, dashes down the track and drives it inside-out over mid-off. One-bounce four. Gorgeous
flatter and faster outside off, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
length-ball offbreak, defended on the back foot
looped up outside off, presses out and defends to cover
short and breaks back in, clipped to square leg
skips out and works it to midwicket
starts outside off and breaks back in sharply, bounces, beats Pujara and hits him on the back thigh
sharp turn and bounce again! Starts outside off, breaks in, rips out the glove. Nearly lobs to leg slip
angled in to the pads at a length, goes deep and punches to short midwicket
slower, middle stump at a length, goes on the back foot again and eases this to long-on
good length at off stump, defended back down the pitch
length at middle stump, closes the face and defends to short leg
full at off stump, angled bat push to short midwicket
length at middle stump, defended with soft hands
tossed up at off stump, opens up and looks to drive against the spin through the covers. Bat turns in his hand, he gets it down to long-on
good length at middle stump, steps out, not to the pitch. But he uses his wrists nicely to go with the turn and flick this through the open square leg area
good length at middle stump, tapped to short leg off the back foot
oh nice. Good length at off stump, he's poking for the turn but this goes straight through. Thick outside edge rolls past first slip
good length at leg stump, defended to short leg
tossed up at off stump, brisk feet to jump out and get to the pitch, drives it straight back to the bowler
good length, pushed flat and down the leg side, tickled to long leg's right off the back foot for a comfortable second
good length outside off stump, steps out and realises he's not to the pitch. Respectfully pushes into the off side
tossed up at off stump, pushed back to the bowler

he's gone! A terrible mix-up. 'My call,' says an annoyed Rahul as he walks away. And it was his call indeed. A full ball at off stump, pushed to extra cover's left and Rahul takes off after calling. Pujara responds too, but changes his mind. By this time, Rahul is halfway down the pitch and there's no way he's making it. The throw is floated in and slightly wide, but Dickwella has enough time
back of a length at leg stump, glanced to short fine
full outside off stump, inside edge onto the pad as he defends, into the off side
reverse swing. Into the batsman, length at leg stump. Pushed safely on the up, steals a single at mid-on
beautiful shot. This tails in at middle stump from a length. He watches it closely, plays late, and turns his wrists at the last moment to get this wide of mid-on
good length and into the pads, flicked to deep square
back of a length and just outside off, shuffles across, lets it go
full outside off stump, hard hands as he tries to drill this through the covers. Inside half of the bat, dribbles to mid-on
back of a length outside off stump. Swinging in, but wide enough to leave
tossed up at leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length at middle stump, defended into the off side
gets it past fine leg. Floated at leg stump, gets on top of it and sweeps along the floor. No one deep, square on the leg side
good length at off stump, opens the face and defends into the off side
good length at off stump, defends into the leg side
full at off stump, steps out and drives to mid-off. Clear calling this time from both batsmen. No run taken
good length outside off stump, tails in sharply outside off stump. Left alone and continues to move in after passing the stumps. Dickwella can't hold on
uff. That hits him hard in the mid-riff. Jags back in from outside off and beats his inside edge as he tries to fend
full and tailing into the pads, pushed to mid-on
good length, swinging in from outside off. Nicely covered as he stretches forward, drives straight to mid-off
good bouncer. But the pitch doesn't quite back him up. Bouncer at the throat, sways away late and this barely makes it to the keeper
good length at leg stump, watchfully tapped to midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to short leg off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
full and drifted into middle stump, gets locked and a thick inside edge on the forward defence
length at middle stump, defended off the front foot
good length at middle stump, drifts in again and gets a the inside half of the bat as he defends
full at middle stump, opens his stance and pushes confidently to mid-off
bouncer, too short. Comfortably under this and he didn't even have to try
good length, swinging in. But once more it's wide enough outside off for him to leave

full and swinging in, gets to the pitch and drives through the line. Good technique. Not the greatest connection, but this is why coaches tell you to play straight. Mid-off can't even think of getting to the that
full outside off stump, tapped back to mid-off
on cue, a bouncer. But he leaps early, watches it closely, and bunts it into the floor towards fine leg
full at middle stump, toe-ended drive back to the bowler
full outside off stump, driven to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended off the back foot to extra cover
back of a length outside off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
good length outside off stump, defended into the off side
full at leg stump, leans in to try and drive this past mid-on. But he's lulled by the loop. Checks the shot, hits it back to the bowler

glorious. Kohli is looking good. Good length outside off stump, leans into it and bisects cover and short extra. Even teases mid-off with that placement and makes him run after it. Good. Someone has to bring the ball back
back of a length at off stump, nips back in and thumps his thigh guard as he tries to glance this
full at middle stump, keeps the front leg out of the way to negotiate the inswing. flicks to short midwicket
good length at off stump, defended into the off side with an open face
bouncer, slants down leg side, over this front shoulder as he lets it go
good length at middle stump, inswing, pushed into the leg side with the inside half of the bat

oh well bowled! Proper set up that. Swings it away this time after long spells of attacking the stumps. Pujara had no clue. This was full at off stump and down came the angled bat expecting inswing. Thick outside edge runs through gully
full at leg stump, defended back down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
good length at off stump, defended solidly
you can't say things anymore these days, so Kohli just hits that fielder instead. A crisp drive, straight into his shin pad

Herath you beauty! Tossed it up for ages and now he pushes one through, back of a length outside off stump. Kohli, high on confidence till now, goes after it with a cut. Gets an edge that absolutely flies to first slip who gets anxious hands up quickly to his right and holds on as it bobbles. Mathews that is. Sighs and gratefully tumbles to his right as he finishes the job

close, close. Top class from Herath. Starts this floater outside off, gets it to dip and drift in sharply. First ball for Rahane. He has a big front foot plant outside off and it nearly undoes him. It's prime to strike him in front of middle, but he gets the bat down just in time
back of a length at muddle stump, punched to short midwicket
back of a length, pushed through fast. Hurries onto the back foot and defends
good length at middle, turns sharply, defended to short leg
back of a length at leg stump, on the back foot, watches it very very close, tucks it to deep backward square
good length outside off, the hands move further than the feet. Prods at this and defends into the off side
good length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot into the leg side
good length at leg stump, defended back to the bowler
full at leg stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side
good length and down leg side, tickles it to fine leg
well played. Back of a length, angled into leg stump. Quickly goes back, gets the front leg out of the way and whips this to the midwicket boundary

shot. Good length, dipping outside off. He's done by flight here, but the feet. Oh, the feet. They have one motive and they succeed. They bring him close enough to the ball and then his bat takes over. Drives on the up to the extra cover boundary
and now he goes on the back foot. This is outside off, and he guides it past slip with an open face to bring up 4000 runs
back of a length outside off stump, on the back foot and pushed into the leg side
good length outside off stump. Done by flight again.This time he's not stepping out so the hands push hard at this. Inside edge goes wide of short leg
steps out, opens the face and taps it to deep point
good length outside off, down the track, pushed to mid-off's left
back of a length outside off stump, chopped off the inside half, to extra cover's left
back of a length outside off, sits up nicely. Pujara goes deep, opens the face, and slices to the third man boundary
good length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length outside off stump, cut to sweeper cover
good length outside off stump, defended down the pitch
good length outside off, down the track, pushed back to the bowler

you felt this was coming. He's pushed this one straight outside off after all the stepping down the batsmen have done. This time he plays from the crease and prods outside off. Outside edge, fizzes past first slip, via his right hand
back of a length at off stump, pushed to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length outside off. Steps out, not to the pitch. Looks to flick, cops it on the pad. It lobs into the off side
oh good shot, but bowler gets a hand. To the pitch outside off and driven hard towards the non-striker
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
good length at middle stump, looks to drive through the leg side, thick outside edge to mid-off's left
tossed up at middle stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at leg stump, defended into the off side
good shot. I suppose. Stepped down, got to the pitch at middle stump and thumped this hard at head height. Just evades the bowler's outstretched right arm
good length at off stump, defended into the off side
length at off stump, defended down the pitch
full at leg stump, clipped with soft hands past midwicket
full and breaks in just outside off, blocked
Mendis is in the firing line again. Dropped shorter on middle, Pujara ventures deep in the crease and pulls over a ducking short leg
skids on middle, defended on the back foot to short leg
Rahane uses his feet and quietly plays this full ball back to the bowler
flighted on middle, defended
slower through the air outside off, Rahane skips down the track, lofts it with the break over midwicket. Excellent shot selection and execution to boot
pushed through on middle, defended
tossed on off, played back to the bowler
this drifts into the leg stump, Pujara skips out and misses the flick. He is rapped on the pad but this is heading down
drifts into leg stump again, Pujara uses his feet again and succeeds in flicking between midwicket and mid-on
slightly short on the leg stump, Rahane is quick to rock back and pull it firmly to the midwicket boundary
faster and flatter, spins in, clipped with the break to backward square leg. Pujara brings up a fifty in his 50th Test
spins into the leg stump, nudged to leg slip, the ball bounces in front and beats him
Pujara forays down the track, opens the face to find the gap at cover. Driven smoothly
Pujara skips out and smothers this full ball on off
short and spins into the thighs, whipped away to deep square leg for two
pushed through on off, Pujara plays back and defends
slower through the air, non-turner on off, blocked to cover
tossed up on off, spins away, Rahane presses forward and edges it... but does not carry to slip
shorter and outside off, punched on the back foot to long-off
Pujara tonks it over midwicket for a flat six! This was a rubbish ball, and it deserved the treatment. Half-tracker outside off, Pujara skips back and sends it over midwicket with a pull
slower and breaks away outside off, opens the face and carefully dabs to point
full and drifts in on middle, defended with bat tightly knit to pad
looped up on off, Pujara stretches out and drives with a closed face to short midwicket
dropped short and attached with width outside off, Pujara leaps back and punches it powerfully to the left of Herath at deepish mid-off
down the track and whipped away to long-on now
Rahane now uses his feet, meets this length ball and bunts it past the right of the bowler
shimmies out, gets too close to the pitch, and jabs a single to long-on
dropped short and wide outside off - ripe for the cut - hit to sweeper cover
pushed on middle and leg, Rahane presses forward and defends to short leg
flatter on the pads, glanced to long leg
whipped from off stump to deep midwicket
straight ball on middle and leg, driven back to the bowler
Rahane goes back and works it off the thigh to long leg
slid through on off, Rahane defends off the back foot
tossed up and drifting across off, Rahane dances down the track and serenely drives it to the left of Herath at extra cover
skids on middle and leg, defended to short leg off the back foot
short and angled across off, slapped away to the left of Chandimal at short cover
pretty full and outside off, driven down the ground to a deepish mid-off
darted short on middle and leg, Pujara goes back and  blocks to short leg
tossed on middle, defended back with a straight bat
nudged off the pads through square leg
half-tracker on off, Pujara lays into another pull, but there's protection at deep midwicket
short on off, back-foot punch to long-on
Placed with laser-guided precision. Pujara uses his feet, gets close to the pitch, drives with the wrists to the left of short midwicket and to the right of mid-on
glanced from outside leg to long leg
looped up on middle and leg, dead-batted
short and slid outside off, Pujara delays the cut and sends it past slip to the third man fence
length ball, drifts in on off, and spins away, blocked stoutly to cover
fuller and outside off, opens the face and drives it serenely through backward point

shot! Pujara has cranked up after reaching fifty. Shortish and outside off, Pujara is right back to punch it strongly to the left of short cover

Rahane is struck on the front pad outside the line. It would carry onto hit off, but it does not matter. Sri Lanka's review ends in vain
bouncer outside off, Rahane sways his upper body out of the way and lets it go

The fielders there are in and Pujara knows this feeling - the one of getting past hundred. Yet another one for him. Scampers back for the second, big beaming smile as he takes his helmet off. Savours yet another standing ovation from the dressing room

so easy on the eye. Slower and full outside off, Rahane collapses his back leg and creams it inside-out through the covers

flatter and slightly quicker outside off, beats Rahane's sweep and hits him outside off. The on-field umpire turns down the leg-before appeal. The reviews will be re-set next over, so why not go for a review. Yep, the tracker confirms the impact is outside the line

angling away around off, Ashwin drives it in the gap at cover
skids on, finishes outside leg, Saha moves back and whips it away in front of deep square
full and angling across off, Ashwin smoothly square-drives it away to deep point
leg side start, on the pads, worked through midwicket for one of the more easier runs of the Test
full and flat on off stump, Saha presses forward to defend
and again. More loop on this one, draws Saha forward. Blocked back
comes down and drives but finds short cover lurking
nicely tossed up on off, driven back to the bowler
a tad short, plenty of width. Easy enough for Saha to go back and clatter a cut to the deep point fielder
a tad short again, Saha reads the length, rocks back and scythes a cut to the sweeper cover fielder
full and straight, on leg. Defended
beautiful bowling. Quick and straight, Ashwin hangs back and prods to point
fantastic stroke. Herath's slow pace means Ashwin can dance down the track, meet the ball as it pitches and lofts the ball easily over long-off with the spin. Another fifty for Ashwin.

six and out! T20 style. Ashwin tries to cut a ball that is far too close to him. It's short, he reads that correctly, but it's also quick and flat, which means the ball keeps drifting in. If he misses his attempted late cut, he's in big trouble. He misses. The off stump is hit. Read the 1-2 trick well did Ashwin, but Herath is a wily bowler.
plants his front foot forward to defend. Good comeback from Herath
slow but full, on the pads. Saha gets his bat in front of the pad to defend
quick on the pads, another block
Saha comes forward but the bowler drags his length back, forcing Saha to defend
the fine sweep. Will get him three. Saha's even looking for a fourth. Well played. Got down early and intentionally played it fine
beaten on the outside edge. So much flight and loop that Pandya is drawn forward, he plays the line but there is enough spin to take that past the outside edge.
rushes down the pitch and squeezes a full delivery to point.
a solid block again. Nice loop on that from Herath
a bit quicker and flatter on the legs, nudged to midwicket
it's good batting. Was unsuccessful with his first attempt, but gets this. Rushes to the pitch, enough room to get underneath the length and lift that over mid-off. Four
easy run as mid-off moves to long-off. Saha drives all along the ground
quicker on the pads, kept out
nice length. Quick on off, 45 mph reads the speedometer. Defended
nicely paddle-swept away to fine leg for a single.
premeditates a sweep and the ball almost goes underneath his sweep. It's quick, and extremely full. Pandya manages the most awkward sweep he might play
another fine paddle sweep. So fine. Just enough bat. Gets it towards the vacant fine leg region for three. Another explosion of dust
the more conventional sweep gets a top edge, Herath at deep backward square leg thinks about that but bails out of the catch
chips down the pitch and pushes this to short cover. Another good over for India
nice use of the feet, it's drifting in from Herath, but Pandya easily clips to long-on
quick and flat on off, defended
nicely looped up, draws Saha forward, a solid block ensues
another terrific delivery. Slow through the air, but short enough to keep Saha's footwork tentative. Kept out
this is leg side-ish and Saha picks one through square leg
shortish outside off, shovelled to midwicket from the crease. A tentative push that
Saha comes down and pushes this towards short cover
a run and an overthrow. Another fine paddle sweep towards Herath at short fine leg. The throw comes in. 'Watch, your end,' says Pandya. The throw misses the bowler's end and they get back for two
Saha comes forward and defends
full on leg, jammed out
gets to the pitch this time and drives to long-off.
another one that beats the outside edge. Flat and quick outside off, the ball spins past the edge
full again on off, solidly kept out by Saha
slow and straight. Saha gets his bat in front of the pad, defended
fired in on leg this time, another block
tossed up on off, broad-bat dead defense

a big appeal. No, says the umpire. Flat on middle and leg, the ball misses the inside edge and hits the pad. Chandimal chooses to review. Looks like it is sliding down. No bat involved. One red, one orange, one green. Going well down. Umpire's call on impact. Not the greatest traffic light for Sri Lanka.
maiden from Herath. Quick and straight, Saha keeps that out
lovely use of the feet, gets to the pitch and drives to long-on.
Saha shimmies down and drives back to the bowler
too short, too wide, too easy for Saha to cut to the sweeper cover fielder

another big appeal, a bigger appeal than the previous one. Another review. Dickwella forces Chandimal to use up their available review. Looks like it pitched outside leg. So much spin that it took the ball past the outside edge and hit Pandya on the back leg. That looks pretty adjacent. No bat involved says the third umpire. Two reds - where it pitched and impact - but one green - the ball bounces over the stumps. Another tight one. Good call from umpire Tucker
Pandya has had enough of prodding and plodding. Runs to the pitch and hammers a drive to cover. The ball bursts through and they get a couple
flat outside off, whipped to mid-on
comes down again and drives to cover
slightly quicker on middle, Saha defends
another solid defensive push towards short mid-on. Tidy from Herath
well played. Slightly short, slightly wide and Saha cuts away through third man for a couple. Deftly played

byes? 57 mph, quick and full outside off. Completely misread the length of that did Saha, who stayed back and looked to drive. The ball beats the keeper and slip too. Beauty. A ripping delivery, not good signs for Sri Lanka
flight on middle and leg, Saha dead-bats it away
nicely tossed up outside off, Pandya blocks

wow. That just missed Rod Tucker. Pandya comes to the pitch, and hammers the ball straight back at Tucker. Drifts towards the umpire, flicks his handkerchief and races away. Yikes. All smiles. A few more inches wider and there are no more smiles
chipped away towards long-on
flat and wide outside off, Saha offers no stroke, it keeps drifting in. Clips the pad and ricochets away. No shot, of course, so the fielders appeal. Did not look out
drives it with the little bit of spin to long-off
quick and straight on off, Saha defends
79 kph, pushes that away towards cover
beauty. Drags that length back, the ball rips and beats the bat
blocked into the off side
nicely played. Quick outside off, Saha stays low and cuts towards point, who dives to his right
lovely use of the feet, gets right to the pitch and drives to long-off. Tidy over from Herath
quick outside off, bunted away towards cover
picked the area, picked the length and picked up four. Short on middle, Pandya stays back and swats a pull through midwicket. No one there.
wow. A front-foot slog sweep through midwicket. Fantastic ball-striking. Full outside off, Pandya plants his front foot forward and gives that a good tonk. Lovely hit.

4, 4 and out. Lovely flight outside off, Pandya comes down, looking for the big hit through long-off, but he doesn't quite get to the pitch. The ball skews instead off the outer half of the bat, lobs up and settles in Mathews' hands at long-off. A nice cameo.
lovely use of the feet again, comes down, meets the ball as it pitches and gets one to long-off
works that away through midwicket for a run. The fielder just can't get to that
overpitched outside off, bunted away awkwardly
nicely tossed up outside off, pushed away towards silly point
quick and straight. Another block towards mid-on
pushed through on off from Herath, Jadeja stays back and defends. Excellently bowled
more flight outside off, driven back to the bowler
another maiden from Herath. Quick on middle and leg, defended
short and wide from the bowler, Saha cuts to the sweeper cover for a single
leg side-ish, worked away towards midwicket
chips down and flicks past midwicket as India get to 500. Plenty of runs
nicely driven with the spin to long-off
slow on middle and leg, inside-edged towards midwicket
driven back to the bowler. 'Over and drinks,' says the umpire. Another good hour for India
tossed up on leg stump, defended to mid-on
Saha steps out, he is right to the pitch of the ball and drives it to the off side
slower through the air on middle, blocked
tossed up and turns away outside off, Saha  swishes at a drive. Skews it off the outside half between point and cover
looped up on off, Jadeja pokes it past slip
shorter and flatter outside off, Jadeja ventures deep in the crease and stabs it wide of short cover
clipped off the pads past the left of midwicket
slow, short, turns away, Saha moves back and forces it on the back foot to short cover. The sub fielder throws himself to his right to stop the ball
short and wide outside off, slapped to point on the back foot
Saha hares down the pitch, Pushpakumara drags his length back on off, jabbed away to short cover
Saha skips out again, whips it from off stump to the right of mid-on
Jadeja now uses his feet, but is deceived in flight, tossed up and spins from outside off. The left-hander ends up dragging the ball away to long-on
leg-stump full-toss, whipped away to the right of deep square leg
pushed through fuller and quicker outside off, opens the face and square-drives it to point
short and skids around off, risky to cut, Jadeja chops to point and gets away
speared on middle, defended on the front foot
length-ball offbreak, starts outside off and twirls away. Jadeja ignores it. He'd rather have a bowl now
down the track and drilled to short cover, where Thirmanne dives to his right to stop the ball
tossed up full on off, pushed back to the bowler
Saha uses his feet and drives another full ball to cover
slightly short on off, slow through the air. Saha skips back and nails a pull to the midwicket boundary
grip and turn, edged to point
looped up on off, dead batted
nice and full on off, Jadeja presses forward and blocks it to cover
shorter and slides in with the arm from around the wicket, defended to the same region on the back foot
sharp angle, skids into the thigh, as Jadeja plays around his front pad and misses the flick
punched from off stump to point off the back foot
dropped short and wide outside off, Jadeja goes back and square-cuts it away
Jadeja stretches out to defend this full ball on off
another donkey drop from Pushpakumara, lands it on middle, defended
tucked off the pads to backward square leg
Saha steps out, this is tossed up and dipping on leg stump, clipped away to midwicket
short and spins away outside off, back-foot slap to sweeper cover
Jadeja races down the track, this spins in, he hacks it to long-on despite not getting close to the pitch
flatter and outside off, jabbed away to cover
full on off, defended with bat and pad knit together. Not sure why Dickwella appealed for that
full on the stumps, eased down to long-on
tucked off the pads to square leg
tossed-up offbreak, worked with the spin to square leg again
dropped short and turns in, Saha goes back and punches it solidly to midwicket
short on off, another back-foot punch, this time to the left of square leg
back of a length and spins in on middle, Jadeja jumps back and flays it to wide long-off
tossed up on middle, defended on the front foot
sharp turn and bounce! Bursts past the outside edge. Good length, angled in on off, and rips past the defensive bat
Saha skips out, Pushpakumara shortens his length on middle. Saha checks his drive and drives it to long-off. He raises a fifty
Pushpakumara tosses it higher and slower on off, Jadeja hares down the track and launches him higher. Pinged straight down the ground. Dumps the bowler into the grass banks
breaking down leg, beating Jadeja now
nurdled with the break to square leg
quicker on middle and leg, worked to the right of square leg now
Jadeja presses forward to smother this full delivery on off
dropped short and wide outside off, slashed to point
length-ball offbreak, finishes on off stump, blocked off the back foot to midwicket
shorter on middle and leg, Saha ventures deep in the crease and forces the ball to short midwicket
angled on off, full, presses forward and pushes to short cover
fuller and wider outside off, driven to extra cover
short and spins into the thigh, Jadeja responds with a back-foot punch to long-on
half-tracker outside off, Jadeja steps back and smashes a pull between deep midwicket and long-on
looped up on off, Jadeja opens the face and pushes it wide of backward point
speared on off stump, Saha looks to work it to leg, closes the face, and ends up plopping a leading edge to off
short and wide outside off, Jadeja goes deep in the crease and flays the ball to point
this is a ripper from Perera! Unplayable. Starts outside off, angled in from around the wicket, and breaks past the defensive bat. Just bounces over the stumps
fuller and outside off, tapped to cover
short and outside off, scythed to point
looped up on off, stretches forward and defends
pushed through on middle and leg, defended back down the pitch
flat and angled across off, opens the face and sweetly punches it to deep point. They take on Herath's arm for two
tossed up on off, Saha pre-meditates a paddle-sweep, and places it fine enough for three
flighted on middle, Jadeja presses forward and plays it back to the bowler
tossed on off, opens the face and pushes it to the right of short cover off the front foot
straight ball on middle, blocked with a straight bat
shorter and outside off, Jadeja sizes it up and short-arms it away to long-on
full on off, no turn, Jadeja smothers it off the front foot
short and angled in on middle, kicks up at Jadeja, but he calmly pats it down
short and wide outside off, delays the cut and finds backward point
angled in on middle and leg from around the wicket, Jadeja dead-bats it
slow and short outside off, Jadeja has plenty of time to rock back and short-arm pull it over the midwicket boundary. Muscled that away
tossed up, defended on leg stump
full on leg stump from around the wicket, driven on the front foot to short midwicket
tickled away square of short fine leg for one more
comes in with the arm on off, Jadeja has a confident stride in defence
fuller and flatter on middle, driven back to him
short and bounces outside off, Jadeja rides the bounce and dabs it fine of short third man

this is smacked back to Dhananjaya. Bursts through his hands. Such was the force of that belt from Jadeja. Tossed up outside off, driven hard back to him. The bowler hardly had time to react, as did Tucker the umpire. TV umpire Illingworth has a wry smile. Tucker ducks and takes evasive action. Long-on had no chance to cut it off as well
slides outside off, punched through backward point
looped up on off, dead-batted
length-ball offbreak, curls in from outside off, heading towards off, but an inside edge saves Saha
drifts in to beat the inside edge and strike the pad in front of leg
lobbed up on middle, helped to square leg
slower and loopier on off, Perera can't breach Saha's defence
tossed up outside off, nudged towards short mid-on
shortish and wide outside off, sliced to backward point
worked away with soft hands towards midwicket. A comfortable brace, one of the more easier ones you get
lots of flight outside off, driven towards cover
pick up and boom. Six. Dances down the track, gets to the pitch and lofts the ball sweetly over midwicket. Hit with the spin. Clears deep midwicket with ease
the hard sweep to deep square leg for a run.
looks to flick this through square leg, but plenty of spin takes this into his pad instead
worked away towards midwicket, where Chandimal parries the ball towards square leg
nicely driven, with a strong bottom hand, to deep cover for a couple more
a thick inside edge towards square leg for one

what happened there? It was exceptional reflexes is what it was, by Kusal Mendis at leg slip. Saha goes for the big sweep, but it came off the pad. Mendis leaps to his right, catches the ball and almost runs Saha out. An overthrow to long-off. Nope, Saha was safe.
pushed back towards the bowler

beauty. That's not a good sign for Sri Lanka at all. Herath has a look at the surface, a worried look. Flat outside off, draws Saha forward, the ball turns, rips and bounces past the edge of Saha. Comprehensively beaten, his balance way off. Dickwella takes the ball cleanly, and takes off the bails. Terrific innings from Saha. Massive explosion of dust.
driven quite languidly to long-on
a tad too much width. Short too. Jadeja stays back and cuts through third man. Another boundary. Played that discernibly late
tickled fine towards fine leg, and that will be Jadeja's fifty. And his sword celebration. Just a little bit on that flick, that's all he needed
whipped down to long-on to keep strike
well bowled. Sees Jadeja coming and shortens the length, short and wide, dabbed to point. Jadeja labours towards the other end.
quick and straight, defended
bludgeoned down the ground. Comes down to the pitch and thrashes that straight back, over the bowler's head
whacked all the way down to long-on this time. Not quite in control. Wanted more midwicket
short and wide outside off, slapped back to the bowler with immense power.
scythed away towards point
inside-edged towards square leg
goes back in his crease and crunches a cut to the sweeper cover fielder
big hit. Just clears long-on, but who cares? Got enough behind it. Not quite to the pitch, but he went through with his stroke and muscular power did the rest
six more. Shami races to 19 off 7. Gets to the pitch and hammers this again, powerful blow over long-off

and gone. Flat down leg, Shami goes back and looks to smash that over midwicket, but gets a thick top edge which lands in deep midwicket's hands. Nice cameo, but how clever was that if India are looking for that 600-mark?
flight outside off, defended by Umesh
that's deft and that will be India's 600. Flat outside off, carved through third man. Nice and late. No point declaring at the start of the over. Can play the whole over and then declare.
nudged towards midwicket
cut away towards backward point for a single
a low full toss outside off is powerfully driven to long-off
nice length. Close to off, dabbed away towards point. One more
inside-edged past short leg for a run to fine leg
tossed up outside off, worked away towards deep point
quick on off, played away
that's all power. Jadeja gets to the pitch, and then goes thwack. Flat six over long-off. Fantastic striking
driven away towards long-off
slow on the pads, played back
another defensive prod. End of another over
quick and straight, blocked away.
dabbed away with soft hands towards backward point. He calls for two and gets it
nudged towards midwicket
defended back
a slog sweep in the gap at midwicket gets Umesh and India another boundary. A proper No. 11 slog.
thwacked away to long-on. And that is it. The declaration has come. India declare at 622 for 9.
wow, that took off. 134 kph, a bouncer on middle. Karunaratne gets underneath that
good length on middle and leg, some inswing. Worked towards midwicket
nice line. Close to off stump, on a length. Defended into the off side.
good length on the pads, worked to midwicket with the angle
the outside edge, on the ground. Good length outside off, in a nice channel. Rahane dives to his right at gully
lovely start. Made him play quite often. Fullish around off, defended away
lovely start. Slow on off, accurate. Tharanga defends
plenty of flight on that, around off, driven towards mid-off
spin with the new ball. That's ripping turn. Slowed up outside off, beats the outside edge comprehensively
quick and straight, blocked
slow around off, another defensive prod. Great bowling

how has he taken that? Rahul at short leg. The dab comes out. Quick on the pads, Ashwin's worst ball. Whipped straight into Rahul's midriff at short leg. Once it's there, Rahul knows he has to hang on to it, so he gets his hands up and clings on. Unlucky, but don't hit it uppishly to a fielder
a bouncer on middle, Karunaratne hustles underneath
fullish outside off, angled across. Played away towards point for a run
full and wide outside off, some outswing. Left alone
good length outside off, 87 mph, left alone. Just enough seam movement
140 kph, good length outside off, Mendis gets to his defensive block late and the ball goes underneath
shortish this time on off, Mendis gets on top of the bounce to defend
slow on the pads, nudged away to midwicket
the carrom ball? Or just the quicker one that did not turn. It was the drifter. Defended
worked away past short leg, for a run. Easily played
beauty. Tossed up outside off, some turn. Hits Karunaratne on the shoulder of the bat
outside-edged towards third man. Squared Karunaratne up there
the in-drifter. Karunaratne doesn't quite pick that, goes back, adjusts well and pushes to cover awkwardly
on the pads, nudged away through midwicket for a run
full around off, inside-edged towards short leg
that's nicely played. A gentle press forward and a lovely crisp caress through mid-off for a boundary. Sweetly done. Teases Ashwin into the boundary
another bouncer on leg, easily underneath. Seems a ploy to push the batsman back.
back of a length from around the wicket, plenty of zip and bounce. 144 kph. Karunaratne awkwardly keeps that out, takes one hand off the bat
clipped just past short leg for a run to fine leg,
flat on off, kept out
quick through the air, Karunaratne strides forward to defend. 'Kabhi bhi ho sakta,' screams Saha (Can happen anytime)
another forward defensive block
on the pads, nudged past short leg for a couple more
beauty. Goes wide of the crease, draws the batsman forward with a full length. The ball then dips, and rips past the edge
and again. Karunaratne actually playing this well. Plays the line - all you can do. The ball does its own thing, ripping, biting and spitting past the outside edge.
flight on off, driven away towards cover
quick and straight, too full. Quick. But a shorter length will be a handful
lovely stop by Dhawan. Full and wide outside off, driven to the cover fielder's right. Dives away
blocked into the off side
goes straighter this time, on middle and leg. Kept out
another one that's full and straight. Jammed out.
another one that beats the bat. Slow on off, Karunaratne plays the line and is beaten
once again. This is volumes of turn. Pitches and rips past the outside edge again
this is the straighter one, the wicket-taker. But Karunaratne gets his bat down
and again. An event a ball. Quick outside off, plenty of turn takes the ball ripping past the outside edge. Another spitting cobra of a delivery
quicker on off, cut away to point. Gets a couple
all that hardwork and Karunaratne gets rewarded with overthrows. Pushes that away towards mid-on for a quick single. The throw from the fielder is slightly wide and there is no one backing up.
comes down and defends to short leg, the squarer one
nudged away through that packed leg side infield for a run to deep square leg
short and wide outside off, cut to point. Mendis distraught he didn't get four.
92 kph, outside off, quick. Draws Mendis forward but the ball darts past the edge. Another beauty.
driven away to cover from the crease
wider outside off, asks Mendis to drive, who says maybe later.
slow outside off, a thick outside edge to gully on the bounce.
slow outside off, driven away
a thick inside edge through midwicket
out comes the slog sweep. Mendis stays low and nails his slog sweep through midwicket
comes down again, looking for a big heave through midwicket. The ball spins in, and hits him on the pad.
more ripping turn. Beats Mendis on the inside edge and hits him on the body
clipped through square leg for a run
short and wide outside off, slapped into the surface towards cover point
good leave. Well outside off
full and wide again, left alone, off the pad to third man, but no stroke offered so no runs
another boundary ball missed on. Short and wide, slashed to point

full outside off, 55 mph, beats Mendis on the inside edge. That skidded on. And Kohli wants a review. The only thing is impact, I think. May have been just outside the line. 'Shot played,' says the umpire. That's an awful review. One red and two greens. That may be India's worst moment this Test.
dangled up full on middle, Karunaratne makes a bit of room and drives it confidently straight of mid-off
looped up on middle, defended
straightens down the line on middle, played back again
drifts in on off, prodded in front of silly-point
another one zips past the outside edge. Tossed up, angled in, and breaks past the bat
tossed outside off, Dimith presses out and defends now
Jadeja finds turn but the length is short enough, allowing Mendis to venture deep in his crease and punch it away in the gap at point
much fuller and tighter on off, Mendis pushes it back to Jadeja
quicker through the air just outside off, kept out
darted in with the arm, Mendis presses out, plays outside the line, jams an inside edge onto the pad
ripping turn and bounce! Good length ball, angled in around off, and viciously breaks past the bat. Mendis was actually late to pull his bat inside the line
dragged shorter and outside off, cut away but straight to backward point
looped up on off from around the wicket, blocked on the front foot to silly-point
drifting into the pads, glanced fine on the leg side off the back foot
this one goes straight on outside off, Karunaratne loosely chases it and watches the ball beat the outside edge

Ashwin finds the outside edge again, Rahane at first slip bends low and snaffles this chance. Full, drifts in from around the wicket, and turns away just enough to graze the edge. Karunaratne did not help himself by prodding with an angled bat with a very short stride
sharp offbreak, good length and turns in to catch the pad. Too much turn, heading down leg

'nuff of prodding and poking says Chandimal. This was pushed through just outside off, Chandimal stretches out and lays into a slog-sweep. Hit with the spin. Chandimal sends the red ball soaring over square leg
full on off, forward-defensive
drifts in on off stump, Mendis deploys a bigger stride and defends it back to the bowler. Well played
low-arm slider, skids into leg stump, Mendis squirts a leading edge to the off side
back of a length and spins away outside off, Mendis has time to move back and punch it to cover
straighter one on off, Mendis gets forward and pushes it back down the pitch
fizzing arm ball, Mendis plays back and drops the ball in front of his feet
quicker one outside off, arm ball, Chandimal eyes up the leg side, loses his balance momentarily, and watches the ball shoot past the leading edge
tossed-up offbreak, defended
on a length on off, blocked off the back foot
starts outside off, spins back in, the length is short, so he goes back and punches it firmly to short cover
Chandimal stretches out and smothers this fuller one on off
tickled with the spin through backward square leg
too full and outside off, driven hard but straight to short cover
whoa! Length ball angled in from around the wicket and rips away past the outside edge with extra bounce. Hike in pace from Jadeja. Good luck to the batsmen on this pitch
speared on middle and leg, played back to the bowler
near yorker on off, backs away and jabs it to the covers
tossed just outside off, streaks off the outside half to point
Chandimal presses forward to push this full ball from outside off to point
starts outside off and spins in from a length, defended with soft hands to backward short leg
carrom ball, Mendis dead-bats it
tossed up, draws Mendis forward and has him poking to short leg
turn and bounce for Ashwin, Mendis plays with soft hands, ensuring it does not carry to backward short leg
full on the stumps, defended
short, turns outside off, defended on the back foot. A puff of dust explodes from the surface
good length on off, Chandimal stretches out to defend to silly point
length ball, angled in, and turns away outside off, good leave from Chandimal
slides in with the arm on middle, Chandimal defends off the front foot
floated up on off, length ball, blocked to silly point
full and outside off, gets forward and drives to short cover
length-ball offbreak, Mendis isn't flustered. Fetches it from outside off and slog-sweeps with the turn over square leg. No protection in the deep. Fine execution from Mendis
shorter from Ashwin, finds turn again from outside off, kicks up at Mendis, lobs off the thigh fine of backward short leg
short legbreak on middle, pushed through quicker, punched on the back foot
worked with the break to short midwicket off the back foot
tossed up, the line is wide outside off. It does not turn much either. Mendis stretches out and pings a slog-sweep over midwicket. It doesn't matter even if it's the penultimate ball of the day
good length and heading towards the stumps. Mendis stops it in its tracks
pushed through on off stump, Chandimal presses forward and defends it watchfully to silly point
tossed up slower, angled in, and turns away outside off, no shot
slides into off stump again, Chandimal has a short stride in defence
good length and outside off, not much turn. Chandimal moves forward - bigger stride - gets close to the pitch and taps it towards vacant cover point and sets off to the other end

wafted between slip and gully! Length ball, angled in, and spins away, kicks up at Mendis. The batsman is caught between jabbing and leaving. These are the seeds these two spinners sow in the mind. Mendis is late to pull his bat inside. Mendis ultimately lobs it nervously between Rahane at first slip and Pujara at gully. The ball just flew between the two close-in fielders
low-arm, fizzer, cramps the batsman for room, whipped to midwicket off the back foot
good length and nibbles away outside off, plays with soft hands and edges it, but it does not carry to slips
back of a length on middle, camps back and pushes to mid-on
lovely delivery from Umesh. Nice and full outside off, swings away so very late, Chandimal thrusts his hands out as the ball whistles past him
short and darts back in on middle, 140.4ks, defended back to him
Chandimal gets on top of a short ball outside off and solidly punches to cover
good length and holds its line outside off, ignored. Excellent start from Umesh
ample bounce which dissuades Mendis, who is all set up to cut this ball like an ugly report card before the parents see it
tosses it up on middle, Mendis covers the line, getting intentionally squared up to block with soft hands

outside edge but it dies on its way to Rahane at first slip. This is excellent bowling from Jadeja, keeping the length full, the line straight, but refusing to give the batsman the chance to get to the pitch of the ball
goes for the flatter ball, ties it with a little room, Mendis cuts but finds the fielder
pushes down the ground with a straight bat, lunging forward to get to the pitch

that's outrageous and it gets the praise it deserves from the cordon as the ball darts past the outside edge like a smooth criminal. Again, the line is on middle, the length brings Mendis forward, the ball dips, not allowing the front foot to reach the pitch and then, well...
defends a 147 kph bulldozer aimed at off stump
143kph, back of a length on off stump, nudges between midwicket and mid-on
punches a short of a length delivery to point
outside edge but it falls short of Rahul, the second slip fielder. And soon as that happens, there's a voice that says 'ek ek step aage' [a couple of steps forward, please]
fuller delivery outside off, offers no shot
the fast bowling cartel helps each other out as Shami, prowling at long leg, races to his left to stop a flick to a bad ball headed for the boundary

straight to square leg! There's enough happening off this pitch without mistakes like these. But perhaps on second thought, that is an attacking fielder, especially to Chandimal, who is an avid sweeper of the ball. He got his first boundary that way, and struck that in the air too. This time India keep a square leg in, behind square, and Chandimal falls into the trap perfectly
beats him first ball but Mathews seems to be playing inside the line, happy to let big turn beat his outside edge
there's the slider, at 90 kph, on off stump, looking to hit the front pad before the bat. Mathews objects to the happy union
ripping turn off middle stump. Means Mathews has to play and the ball laughs past his outside edge

dropped at gully by Kohli, diving to his left. This line of attack, with this purchace off this pitch, always threatens the outside edge. Mathews is squared up as he looks to defend into the on side, the leading edge comes out, teases the Indian captain who shells it
gets down low for the paddle sweep and Jadeja obliges by bowling the perfect ball. Full on leg, sent packing with a bon voyage note stuck to it
139kph, back of a length on middle, Mendis blocks
defends a back of a length delivery as gently as you would help a baby into bed. And because of that the ball nearly wanders onto his stumps!
blocks a good length ball on off stump, and it was at serious pace too - 143 kph.

taken at mid-on! India have another and poor Mendis has to walk back. He wants to lift the ball - good length on leg stump - over the infield. An effort to try and break India's stranglehold, but he doesn't quite get enough on it. And Kohli, running back, quickly enough, makes a slightly difficult catch look ridiculously commonplace
blocks a shortish delivery on middle and leg
pastes a 141 kph good length ball through cover. That's a top shot, and hey, if you got it, you gotta flaunt it
strides forward to block on middle and off
blocks a quicker delivery on middle, expecting it to straighten and so it does

huge puff of dust. It's like an Eastwood movie and Jadeja's the mean man under the hat, low over his brow, surveying the carnage. He plants a good length grenade on off stump and it takes off past the outside edge and into Saha's gloves. Boy, the wicketkeeper's got a massive job to do today
quick, 95 kph, and on middle, pushes it to mid-on
he wants to dispel the close-in fielders, so he takes on a good length ball spinning away from his reach and despite the risk sweeps it over midwicket. That could easily have been top-edged
full on off stump, pushes it to mid-on
punches a shortish delivery into the covers, where Kohli dives around to prevent singles
full and outside off, Dickwella slices it to the third man boundary. Bat=knife. Ball=butter. Umesh=annoyed chef
gets up tall against the short ball at 142 kph and blocks
back of a length and outside off, spears it to gully
full on middle and leg, Dickwella nudges to mid-on

dips on him so late and so Mathews, looking to keep away from the ball to have the room to slam it through cover, has to then work extra hard with his wrists to smother the turn and keep the ball down
steps down and flicks a fuller delivery outside off to the left of mid-on
steps forward to block a quick, but full delivery on off stump
fires it into leg stump at 96 kph, wanting the pitch to give it a little oomph. Mathews is playing with a closed face and finds a single to square leg
shifts outside off to pull out his favourite sweep. Two things with this shot, he's exposed his stumps, and he did so to avoid Kohli at short backward square leg. Risk-reward, the Dickwella way
hits the short leg fielder and wanders to the right of Kohli. Dickwella goes for the sweep again and it bounces off the back of, I think, Rahul
full on off stump, pushes to short cover
short and angled into the body, at 141 kph, Dickwella does well with a controlled little pull behind square leg
pins him just above the kneeroll as Mathews falls over trying to flick. But umpire Oxenford thinks this would miss leg stump. Too quick for the batsman. Feet going nowhere. Bat coming down as a token
143kph, full on off stump, defends
143kph, blocks a full delivery on off stump, and Mathews again, doesn't look entirely comfortable behind it
full and just outside off, Mathews pats it back down the pitch. Had Sri Lanka been in a better position, he would have laced it down the ground.
shifts away to have the room to cut a flatter delivery that spins into him like his thigh-pad has been transformed into a red-ball magnet
leans forward to a flighted delivery outside off and pushes to mid-on

93 kph - and that pace, combined with the length - so full - and the line - on off stump - makes the batsman play only for the wild turn to tell him how futile he was in thinking he could get bat to it
hangs back and cuts the shortish delivery towards point
stays deep in his crease again and makes the turn work his his favour, cutting through cover
blocks a short delivery on off stump to cover
pulls out the sweep, taking a loopy delivery on off stump and showing it the sights at deep square leg
flicks to the right of short midwicket, where Kohli grabs it one-handed and tries to run Dickwella out at the non-strikers'
presses forward to block a flighted delivery on middle and leg
loops it up, and as a result, it drifts across the right-hander. Mathews defends
pulls out the sweep, and it's aerial. Shami covers it well enough, putting his body behind the ball, and minding the spin into him behind square
wanders down the pitch and though he isn't close enough at all to the ball, he goes through with the shot and gets great reward
short ball, outside off, slaps it to point
that's a sensational hit! Fitting to bring up the hundred. Mathews sees the ball on leg stump and meets it with a straight and angry bat
beats him next ball - and it's the usual dart from Jadeja, pitching full on middle, and leaping past the outside edge and into the wicketkeeper like a happy child into their parents' arms
turns a fuller delivery on leg stump through deep square leg
plays it on line - the slog sweep, seeing the room outside off - and he makes sure to mind the turn and bounce. Dickwella has a great sense for the cricket ball.

pulverises the overpitched delivery over Jadeja's head. Massive strike. Sri Lanka are actively trying to put India's spinners off their lengths. But with 600-plus on the board, that should be a bit hard
goes back to a reasonably fuller delivery and has to go through the hassle of bringing his bat down rapidly to protect his stumps, and his pads

makes room and lashes a short delivery on the stumps through point. Ashwin is bowling a lot slower than Jadeja and that is allowing the batsman the time to play shots like these. That's the fifty partnership
blocks a quicker delivery on middle and leg to mid-on

that's a mis-hit and with Jadeja at deep square leg, the sweep will remain a risk. Dickwella knows he is good with that shot though and gets away with it as the ball goes to the right of India's best fielder
pushes through on leg stump, Dickwella nudges through vacant midwicket

that is simply not possible and yet Pujara comes up with the ball in his hand! What a catch at leg gully, off a full blooded flick behind square leg! We can savour the moment as the umpires check on the legality of the catch. Ashwin gets a little bounce on the offbreak, and Mathews tries to ride it, and he might well have because the ball is going down to Pujara's left. But he moves smartly, gets his hand under the ball and takes it superbly
pushed through and heading towards off, Dickwella stops it in its tracks with a straight bat
Dickwella pre-meditates a reverse-sweep, this breaks sharply and bounces past the leg stump and Saha
speared on off stump, 94ks, Dickwella anticipated it. Hung back and worked it wide of short leg
Dickwella continues to be proactive. He runs down the pitch now, gets close to this full ball on middle, and bunts it down to long-on

bye, bye Dhananjaya. What a ball from Jadeja! What a way to bring up 150 wickets in Test cricket. Quick fizzer, nearly 95ks, too fast for Dhananjaya to press forward. Slides in from around the wicket and turns away slightly with extra bounce to open him up, beat the outside edge and kiss the off bail. The turn wasn't sharp but the bounce was. More clouds of dust from the surface
pushed through and fired on off, Dilruwan can't get forward either, he drives it away to mid-off
Ashwin tosses it outside off, Dickwella sees the width out and goes low for the sweep but does not make contact
another tossed up ball outside off, slower than the previous one, but it breaks away further, beating the sweep again
dropped short and outside off, spins away further, Dickwella thrusts his hands out and flashes it to backward point
quicker and outside off, carved to point
flighted and wide outside off, not much turn, Dickwella stretches out, controls a sweep, by rolling his wrists on top of the ball. Stroked to deep midwicket
good length and spins in on middle, Perera defends capably
hurled outside off, Jadeja is faster than Ashwin. So Dickwella is hurried into a sweep. Hits it uppishly but the ball does not carry to Kohli at backward square leg
Jadeja offers very little flight, this is speared at nearly 100ks, Dickwella still dares to dash out and smack it over wide mid-on
sharp turner, zips back in from outside off, cramps Dickwella for room. He jabs it down
slower and just a shade outside off, Dickwella unfurls the sweep again. Goes low and lifts it over backward square leg though he wasn't in total control of the shot
straight ball outside off, Dickwella does not get enough bat on the sweep. Tickled to leg slip
hint of flight on off, Dickwella takes another trip down the pitch. He meets this full one and bunts it down to long-on
faster and shorter outside off, allowing Dickwella to use the depth of the crease and crunch it to cover
back of a length and turns away outside off, not full enough, tapped to point
the change of angle does not fluster Dickwella. Pushed through outside the leg stump, this line feeds the sweep as well. He opens up his hips and pastes it over midwicket
Dickwella expects the shorter ball, camps back, takes it from the stumps and manufactures a cut through the covers
pushed through outside off, spins in a bit, inside-edged onto the pad
Ashwin tosses it up generously outside off, 77ks, Perera likes the flight. He gallops down the track, extends his hands, and launches it over the long-on boundary. Clean strike
Dickwella pre-meditates the reverse again. But this is on off, he is cramped up and the length isn't quite there for the shot as well. He ends up shovelling it towards mid-off
low-arm, slides in, disturbs the surface, and turns past the outside edge
starts outside off, another one that turns past the outside edge
Jadeja keeps firing darts, on a length on off, defended
full on middle and leg, clipped away to leg
non-turner on off stump, Dickwella whips it through midwicket to keep strike
looped up outside off, Dickwella sweeps his way to a 44-ball fifty. He stretched out, rolls his wrists, and directed the ball to deep midwicket. His intent and execution has been excellent
starts outside off and twirls in, defended to short leg
pushed through on on off, nudged through cover

Has Saha missed a stumping chance here? Too difficult. Turn and bounce, curves in from outside off, zips past the inside edge, kisses the top of the pad. Saha has to deal with a lot of extra bounce and can't collect it cleanly
shorter on of, goes back and punches it back to Ashwin
breaks into the pad and lobs to the close-in fielder
short and spinning down leg, left alone
worked with the spin to backward square leg
Dickwella races down even before Jadeja delivered. He pulls his length back and ensures the batsman does not get anywhere close to the pitch. Dickwella still adjusts and flicks to midwicket
hurled outside off, 96ks, Jadeja finds extra bounce as well, no shot
tossed outside off and spins away, Perera plays with soft hands and ensures the soft outside edge does not carry to second slip
looped up on off, Perera has a giant stride and defends it stoutly to cover

Dickwella's high-risk cricket fetched him a 44-ball fifty. His high-risk cricket now sees him scoop the ball right back onto the stumps. He pre-meditates by venturing a long way across the off stump. Shami keeps his head. Good length and angled in on off, Dickwella attempts to ramp it over the keeper's head, T20 style. Just deflects it back onto middle and off stumps, about half an hour before lunch
dug in short and outside off, can't sweep or reverse these. Herath stands up tall and forces it back to the bowler
good length and angled in on off, Herath covers up in defence
133ks head-hunting lifter from Shami, he hits the deck hard and has Herath ducking hurriedly
short and wide outside off, 142ks, Herath stands up tall and flat-bats it away past the right of Ashwin at short cover

Shami cleans up Herath! It's all going pear-shaped for Sri Lanka. The bowler goes wide of the crease and slants it in, Herath looks for a big whip across the line. Shami hurls it at nearly 140ks and shoots through Herath as the ball thuds into middle stump

Dilruwan comes a loooong way down the track. Jadeja spots it, pulls his length back significantly, lobbed off the thigh pad to gully as he offers no shot. Had the fielder thrown the stumps down, Dilruwan would have been run out
yorker, swerves in on off, right in the blockhole, kept out
good length on off, quicker, Perera taps it to cover
slides in outside off, Perera rolls his wrists and hits it flat and hard through backward square leg. Good execution of the sweep
rare error from Jadeja. Short and width outside off, Perera cashes in and cuts it firmly through backward point. There's no protection in the deep
tossed outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
good length and angled in on off, defended back on the front foot
Shami goes up for an lbw appeal. This was full and angled into middle and leg, raps the pad, as he plays down the wrong line. Inside edge? Yep, Ultra Edge detects it
middle-stump yorker, squeezed out
hurled short, slanted in, 89ks, Pushpakumara drops his gloves, he chestbutts it away to the cordon
good length on off, 143ks, blocked
full and straight on middle, Pushpakumara presses forward and covers up in defence
on a lengthy and wide outside off, flat-batted away to deep cover.
skids into leg stump, hurries onto Pushpakumara, who squeezes an inside edge to midwicket
tossed outside off and turns away, no shot
pushed through full on off stump, Perera is very good with the sweep. Goes low and sweeps it flat and hard to the midwicket boundary
slides on off, opens the face and dabs it to point
darted faster and just a shade outside off, extracts sharp turn and sharper bounce to skirt past the outside edge
Pushpakumara stands tall to meet this 139ks short ball outside off and punch it to Umesh at backward point
pitched up on off, Pushpakumara answers with a good-looking front-foot drive. Jadeja dives to his wrong side - right - from mid-off and tracks the ball down
dug in shorter on off, Perera gets on top of it and pats it down
full and slanted in on off, clipped away to the right of mid-on
picked off the hips through square leg for one
big bouncer outside off, Perera lets it go. Saha leaps to collect it
grip, turn, and extra bounce. Angled in and jives past the forward-defensive
faster and flatter outside off, presses forward and lets it go
flighted on off, stretches out and pushes the ball to cover
slides in with the arm on off, 95ks, another forward-defensive from Pushpakumara
short and turns away outside off, swatted away half-heartedly to mid-on
straight ball on middle, capably pushed to mid-off
hangs it up outside off and gets it to dip,Perera presses forward and smothers it
