bowled'em. India wrap up Sri Lanka for 171. Oh wait, India are hanging around to see if Pradeep will bat. And he walks in with an injured hamstring. Poor fella. Out goes Perera. This was tossed up delightfully outside off, spins in, floats through the gate to hit the stumps. Perera was drawn forward to drive against the break
tossed up outside off, blocked on the front foot
slower through the air and breaks in, prodded wide of short leg off the front foot
full offbreak, kept out
slid through on off stump, Pradeep angles a defence to cover
tossed up on off stump, Pushpakumara clears his front leg and hoicks it over the long-on boundary
quicker on off and spins away, rushing past the slog-sweep
Dropped by Umesh Yadav running back from mid-on. He gets into an awkward side-on position and shells it. Pushed on off stump, Pushpakumara skies a loft and survives
turn and bounce, kicks past the outside edge to Saha
low full-toss on middle, bunted to midwicket
slider on off, Pradeep defends from the crease
carrom ball, Ashwin is showing his range at the SSC, defended back to him. Pushpakumara picked it off the pitch
Pushpakumara shimmies out, Ashwin drags his length back and gets it to break in, Pushpakumara is forced to pad up to it
pushed through on the stumps, whipped away through midwicket

Poor Pradeep. He walks in with an injured hamstring and gets bowled for a duck. Ashwin caps the innings with another five-wicket haul. He hung this offbreak up outside off, turns in, Pradeep was attempting to let it go. The ball grazes the inside edge and rolls back onto the stumps
good length ball outside off, Karunaratne defends intentionally inside the line so that his outside edge is safe
full on off stump, drives to mid-off
covers the line of a back of a length delivery on middle and leg and nudges it behind square leg
firm push to mid-off, showing the fielder the full face of the bat
pulls his bat inside the line of a shortish delivery angled across him
leans forward and blocks with soft hands such that the 84 mph delivery, even though it takes the outside edge, wanders safely past gully
pushes it through on a good length, just outside off. There is no spin this time and Tharanga blocks with hard hands
drifts in lazily fro off stump to middle, Tharanga blocks it carefully
brings down a straight bat in line with a full delivery on middle
makes him reach a touch outside off with an offbreak pitched up

beats him. That's the length. Full, but not quite enough that the batsman can reach the ball where it pitches. After that, with the amount of revs Ashwin puts on it, it's only a miracle if the ball doesn't turn
seems to go on with the arm again, perhaps it is that upright seam arm-ball, meaning to test the inside edge. Tharanga blocks
back of a length and outside off, goes for the cut and is beaten
blocks a good length ball on middle
turns a shortish delivery at 141 kph behind square leg
lets the shortish delivery come to him and he taps down it with the gentlest touch
opens the face and punches a short and wide delivery through cover

beautiful bowling! It's a nip-backer and it's a right good 'un. Really, it's a bit like the perfect con artist, waiting until its mark is in the worst possible position - Tharanga with his front leg not really moving, his head falling over, a gap between bat and pad and the stumps perfectly left open for the full-length ball, pitching on off and darting in off the pitch to slam into it.
tosses it up on off stump, pushes down to mid-off
gets down the track, but upon realising he can't get to the pitch, nor can he free the arms, he blocks and is struck on the pad. Too far down for the lbw appeal
another appeal as Ashwin gets the ball to slide on and hit the pads, both of them, but the umpire says no again
shimmies a little and flicks a half-volley on middle through wide mid-on
ripping turn off pretty much the same length and line as the others that came on with the arm. Karunaratne is caught in the crease defending and the ball skips past him
hangs back and blocks a quicker, good length delivery on middle
brings a straight bat down in front middle and leg
clips a fuller delivery off his pads, but midwicket denies him the chance to get off the mark
gets up right behind the back of a length delivery on off stump
stout-hearted defence from Mendis as Umesh continues bowling short but straight

seems to flirt with a good length ball at 87 mph outside off. Mendis pulls his bat inside the line perhaps just in time. Good bowling from Umesh, changing the length, and deriving movement after plying the batsman with several short balls
blocks towards point, with a slightly open face

how has that missed off stump?. So good, especilaly with the new ball. Because it's hard, and it can get quicker turn than if it was soft. But for a spinner to control it so well, to make it drift in sharply, dip so that the batsman on the front foot can't reach it, and rag past the outside edge...
goes for the reverse-sweep - he's made to play high-risk shots because of Ashwin's control - and the ball only just goes over the slips
lunges forward to block outside off
this is pushed through on middle and leg, Karunaratne stays back and tries to nudge to midwicket, but he gets a leading edge because of the turn
defends a fastish delivery on middle and off
a touch short, allowing Karunaratne the time he needs to back and punch the ball with the turn through cover
swivels on the back foot as he gets on top of the short ball and pulls it to the square leg boundary
reverts to the fuller length, danging the ball outside off for the outside edge. Karunaratne doesn't oblige
back of a length and outside off at 141 kph, pushes to cover
blocks another 141 kph delivery, this one on middle
eyes on the ball, body behind it, defending late. He's definitely doing all he can to stay out in the middle. Just like he did in the previous innings.
fuller delivery, outside off at 135 kph, lets it go
a couple of steps down to flick a flighted ball on middle and off to short midwicket
meets the tossed up, and drifting away, delivery on the front foot and sends it to mid-on
appeal for lbw as Karunarante strides down the pitch to block outside the line of a slider on middle and off.
puff of dust as this quicker, flatter delivery hits a good length area on leg stump. The line helps Karunaratne get off strike with a flick behind square

dropped at mid-on. Could Dhawan have done better, pushing forward and getting his fingers under the ball? It was dying, so it was a touch difficult. But at this level... In any case, Mendis, haring down the pitch to slam the ball over the top, survives despite the mis-hit
blocks into the leg side
back of a length on off stump, defends
the ball keeps coming into the body at 138 kph, Karunaratne clips to short midwicket
he seems to like this angle, and this length. Another short ball into the body is sent to the deep square leg boundary
moves across onto off stump, waits until the ball is under his eyes, and works it to midwicket
well bowled, and wisely left alone. Shami pitches it up just outside off, Karunaratne shuffles across and watches it very very carefully before choosing to do nothing
another leave alone as Shami seems to be getting the ball to straighten a tad, at 138 kph, and off a good length.
defends a flighted delivery on off stump
fine shot, enabled by his foray down the pitch, and his decision not to overhit the flighted ball outside off. Gets a boundary past mid-on's left for his trouble.
this time he holds nothing back, and the ball sails over deep midwicket. Spots a loopy delivery outside off and gives it his best wallop
another trip down the pitch to tap a tossed up ball outside off to long-on
now it's the left-hander's turn to race down the pitch to Ashwin, who then pushes it through onto leg stump to prevent any hitting room

well waited, and the late cut finds the boundary because of it. Helps that Ashwin bowls this one short, and the pitch, for once does something in the batsman's favour, for the turn is enough for Karunaratne to free his arms
excellent shot, between midwicket and mid-on, enabled by Shami straying a touch too close to leg stump
defends to short midwicket the just short of a good length delivery on middle
goes for the drive, because the length demands it, but Karunartne ends up playing the shot a touch too early. The ball, as a result, goes to short midwicket
unveils another good cut shot, getting close to the short of a length delivery and outside off, and then playing gently
straightens off a good length, right in line with off stump, so Mendis has to play and he gets a bit of an outside edge to point
blocks a short ball at 138 kph on middle stump
comes down the track for a push to mid-on. First ball's at 89 kph, full and outside off
a reverse sweep over the head of the short third man fielder. He decides the shot is worth the risk with the fielder up. But this comes off a top edge
drives to mid-on and sets off straight away
tossed up on off stump, opens the face and drives to cover
stays in his crease and has to adjust to a quick, but full delivery, aimed at off stump with his hands

a slog sweep over mid-on this time! Sri Lanka are going to go the Dickwella way, hitting the spinners out before they settle into a rhythm. Not the worst plan, really. Just that India can persevere with their own wit ha 387-run lead
loops it up outside off, drawing out the cover drive. But because the ball dips, Karunaratne is beaten
pushes this one through on middle and leg, Karunaratne defends with bat in front of pad
presses forward to block a flighted delivery on off stump
defends a quicker, but full length delivery on off stump, and gets an outside edge past the right of silly point
hangs back to block a short of a good length ball on middle and leg. But it turns so sharply Karunartne is playing it in front of off stump
conscious of not closing his bat face too quickly, Karunaratne pushes a ball angled into his pads to mid-on
tosses it up on off stump, defends
brings himself forward to block on off stump
short and outside off, Mendis slaps to backward point, where Abhinav, the substitute for Shami, moves quickly to his right

ripper beats the outside edge, but Mendis might well have accounted for that possibility, playing inside the line of the ball, playing for the one coming on with the arm on middle, and not following the turn
shortish and outside off, dabs it towards point

massive appeal, but the wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha who caught the ball is really not keen on this, and he persuades Kohli not to take the review. Just another good length ball pitching on off and taking exit 53 past the outside edge. Ultra-Edge confirms Saha is right
tosses it up outside off, Karunaratne plants a defensive, but open faced, bat down on it
goes for a sweep, off middle, risky. But in this case, he gets just enough bat on the ball to prevent lbw

that's just sexy right down to the puff of dust erupting from the pitch. It is tossed up, it drifts in, dips before the batsman can get anywhere near it, and then leaves the outside edge behind like a hasty vacationer forgetting their sunscreen
shortish and outside off, Karunaratne tries to cut, but the bounce beats him
another play and miss, this time the bounce is lower than Karunaratne expects as he cuts
upon seeing the ball pitched up - and just outside off - Mendis pulls out the hard sweep and nails it through midwicket. Has he found the switch for Pallekele mode?
tosses it up on off stump, defends
explosion of the pitch as the high-pace, good length ball zips past the outside edge like a runaway train
that's even better! Mendis thinks he can reach the pitch of this flighted delivery, he's driving at it, signalling that intent. But Jadeja and the pitch do him in again
pushes it through quick on off stump, Mendis defends well
shortish and outside off, Mendis thinks about a cut, but the bounce is too high and so he pulls out.
Dimuth pre-meditates a lap. He stretches across the off stump. The line and length - outside off and full - allows him to execute that shot. Swept behind square
nasty bounce! Raps the glove. Tossed up, bursts off the pitch, creates a massive puff of dust, but there's nobody at short leg to catch it
full and loopier outside off, Dimuth strides forward, meets the pitch, and smoothly drives down the ground
short offbreak from Ashwin. Mendis picks the length. Swivels on the back foot and shovel-sweeps it over short leg
pushed through flatter and outside off, Mendis stretches out, fetches it from there, and sweeps it flat and hard to deep midwicket
straying into the pads, Dimuth presses forward and confidently flicks it away through the vacant spaces at midwicket
Jadeja's quicker than Ashwin, spins in from outside off, Dimuth sweeps it with the turn behind square
starts outside off, breaks and kicks away further, Mendis wisely does not play
quick and skids on in the channel, no shot again
slides in with the arm, no flight at all, jabbed back down the pitch
round-arm, angled in from outside off, Mendis plays for the angle like most batsmen do. But Jadeja viciously gets it to break past the outside edge

Did this flick the outside edge on the way to Saha? Big appeal for caught behind. Jadeja wins an appeal from Oxenfored. Mendis asks for a review. Replays show daylight between the bat and ball. The bat is a long way inside the line. The ball flicks the thigh and settles into the gloves of Saha. They check for the lbw as well, but this is bouncing over the stumps. This ball was just doing too much. Fired in from wide of the crease, Mendis plays the angle again, but this turns sharply past the bat
fired too full, not the ideal length to sweep, Dimuth aims a sweep and drags a bottom edge to backward square
pitched up and outside off, eases forward and drives to the covers
faster and flatter outside off, spins away, Dimuth jabs it away to point
tossed up outside off, Dimuth presses forward and blocks it to silly point
flighted and outside off, left alone
short and attached with width outside off, Mendis jumps deep in the crease and crisply strokes it to the left of short cover. Punched away sweetly to the boundary
extravagant turn and bounce. Full and outside off, leaps past the outside edge. Mendis did well not to thrust his hands at the ball
fired outside off, Jadeja finds extra bounce, Mendis deals with it by getting on top of the bounce and cracking it away to the point boundary
pushed through fuller on off, Mendis stretches out and absolutely nails a sweep to the square leg boundary. Rolled his wrists and controlled it superbly
round-arm slider, about 10ks faster than the last ball, fired onto the pads, Mendis aimply helps it fine on its way for a hat-trick of fours

A mix-up between the wickets! Could have been horrible for Sri Lanka. Tossed up outside off, driven straight to mid-off, and Mendis hares across towards the other end. But Dimuth rightly sends him back in time. There wasn't a single there
tossed up outside off, Dimuth presses forward and drives it to short cover
Dimuth dances out, meets a full ball on middle, and drives it wide of mid-on
short and spins in on middle, Mendis goes right back in the crease and pulls it firmly with the spin to deep midwicket

quick, short, wide outside off, Dimuth laces a back-foot cut to sweeper cover. There's a direct hit at the non-striker's end from Umesh, I think. Dimuth lazily jogs across but has slid his bat in time
tossed up outside off, Mendis sizes it up. He stretches out and drills a sweep to deep midwicket. Right off the middle of the bat, hit along the ground
looks like the legbreak from Ashwin, comes into Dimuth, finishes on the pads. Wrong line as he picks it off for a single
tucked around the corner to backward square leg
really full and outside off. Mendis eyes up a slog-sweep, but changes his mind at the last moment and drives it to cover instead
skids on outside off, non-turner, Mendis stretches out and crunches a sweep to the right of mid-on. There's no stopping that
another flat,hard sweep. Pinged from outside off to deep midwicket now
full and spins in on middle and leg from over the wicket, too straight, clipped away through midwicket
round-arm slider from Jadeja, fizzes in from wide of the crease, Mendis plays back to this and squirts an inside-edge onto the pad. That saves him
Ashwin throws this up on off stump, Dimuth presses forward, opens the face, dabs to point
really full and just outside off, squeezes a drive off the front foot to Kohli at short cover
full and straight from around the wicket, nurdled to midwicket
Dimuth thrusts his hands out and watches the ball whistle past the bat. Tossed up outside off and breaks away with big bounce. It was doing too much to snatch the edge
good length on off, Dimuth presses forward and defends to cover
slides on off, opens the face and runs the ball square through the off side with soft hands
lobbed up on off, Mendis is right forward to smother it. Lovely footwork
Mendis' fifty and SL's 100 in one blow. He stretches out to sweep, but the extra bounce takes a thick top edge and flies over Saha
speared on off stump, this flat dart it swept hard to deep midwicket
an appeal for lbw. Not given. India decide against a review. Good length ball, spins in sharply and catches the thigh. Impact in line with off but the ball was doing too much. Heading down leg
flatter and quicker, extra bounce and hits him high on the thigh. The impact was outside the line here
turning sharply down the leg side, left alone
tossed up on off, defended
short offbreak, comes back in, too close for the cut although the length as there. Mistimes it through the covers
sliding into off, short, Dimuth stands tall and forces it away past midwicket. Pujara - wobbly knees and all - chases it
tickled away to the fine-leg boundary. Wrong line - on the pads - and Dimuth brings up a fifty of his own
Ashwin finds extra bounce and turn outside off, Dimuth has nothing to do with it
good length, slanting in, and straightening past the outside edge to Saha. Top-quality delivery
good length and on off, shuffles across and blocks it carefully
back of a length and outside off, Mendis takes it on the up and punches it crisply to cover
just short of a good length and outside off, Mendis moves onto the back foot and punches the ball straight to point. Can't find the off-side gap again
length and wide outside off -  wider than a set of stumps outside off - Mendis looks to hit on the up again. Carves it away through the cover-point region
tight line on off, Mendis is equally tight in defence, pressing right forward and blocking it back to the bowler
flighted on middle and leg from over the wicket, played back to Ashwin
full and straight, Dimuth sweeps from the stumps through vacant leg slip
slid across off with the angle, Dimuth covers his off stump and shoulders arms
short and wide outside off, Dimuth uses the depth of the crease and cuts it firmly to sweeper cover
on a length and spins back into Mendis, defended from off stump to short leg. Well played
tossed up slower and higher, lovely dip and spin, takes the inside edge and trickles away behind square as Mendis wasn't quite close to the pitch of it
good length and angling into a solid forward-defensive on off
wide of the crease, Umesh slams this into the top of the bat as opposed to bat hitting ball
straying into the hips, helped away to fine leg
full and nibbles in a touch, finishes on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
pitched up and nibbles in again, Dimuth looks to drive. Skews off the inside half to mid-on
back of a length and angled in, clipped away with the angle wide of midwicket
nudged off the pads to backward square leg
pitches outside leg, Dimuth stretches out and kicks it away with his pad
Ashwin lands it outside leg again, Dimuth pads up again
straight ball on middle, presses forward and plays it back to Ashwin
short offbreak on middle, defended on the back foot
flighted on the leg stump, Dimuth presses forward and smothers it
goes too full and strays into the pads, Mendis merrily tucks it around the corner
full and outside off, Mendis drives it on the up but can't get it past mid-off
pitched up and outside off - right in the slot for the drive - he presses forward and hits it to the right of short cover, who stretches his hand out and intercepts it
back of a length and more width outside off, steered down to third man
wide of the crease, angling into the pads, Umesh gets away as Dimuth's flick finds square leg
Umesh strays on the pads again, this time Dimuth punishes him. Does so politely. Just deftly glances it fine on the leg side
extra bounce for Ashwin, some turn, surprises Mendis who gloves it through where leg slip may have been
Mendis pre-meditates a reverse, Ashwin pushes it through on the stumps, Mendis adjusts and defends
length and outside off, jabbed past slip
Mendis shapes for the orthodox sweep now, drags it off the bottom edge to square leg
looped up on off from around the wicket, Dimuth presses forward and drives it nicely to mid-off
tossed up outside off, grips, and turns away outside off, Dimuth thrusts his pad out
nice and full outside off, Mendis stretches out and drives it straight to straight short cover
Mendis is right forward to defend this length ball to square short cover
short and wide outside off, slapped to extra cover
back of a length and cuts in on middle and leg at 125ks, slower offcutter, defended to mid-on
full and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off, toe-ended rather
full on off, shuffles across off and pushes it straight to mid-on
tossed up on off, blocked to short cover
flighted and very full on off, Dimuth makes some room and crashes it to mid-off
Dimuth stretches out, paddles it from middle stump to fine leg
point had been whisked out before this ball, and Mendis reverses the ball through this region. Pushed through on off, Mendis exploits the gap with great execution
full offbreak, swept from the stumps to fine leg now
slides just outside off from around the wicket, Mendis plays back and defends
just short of a good length and outside off, ripe for the cut, Dimuth leans back and cracks it away wide of backward point, beats third man to his right. Nicely placed
back of a length and comes in on middle and leg, Dimuth stands tall and forces the ball to midwicket
skidding into the thigh, 140ks, Dimuth falls over trying to flick
good length and nibbles in on middle and leg, blocked back on the front foot
slower legcutter on the leg stump, Dimuth delays his glance to long leg
full and angled in on middle, Mendis presses forward and across in defence
full on middle and leg, tapped to mid-on
defended to silly point on the front foot
shorter and outside off, chopped away off the back foot through cover point
short and on the pads, whipped away to deep square leg
Dimuth presses forward to defend this tossed-up ball on off
flatter, angled in, and spins away, Dimuth does well to defend off the back foot
slides in on leg stump, too full, whipped straight to midwicket
pushed outside leg, Mendis sweeps flat and hard to long leg
tossed on off stump, presses forward and pats it through midwicket
nice and full outside off, Mendis drives on the up, beating Umesh diving to his left at wide mid-off. Creamed to the fence
turns, bounces, takes the outside edge near the higher part of the bat and rolls to point
round-arm slider, short and finishes on middle, defended off the back foot
flighted on off, presses forward and defends to silly point with soft hands
looped up on off and bounces more than Dimuth expected it to. Beaten on the sweep
tossed up outside off, Dimuth reaches out and edges it with soft hands, does not carry to slip
skidding into the pads, clipped behind square off the back foot
pushed through outside off, Mendis drags a sweep to long leg
tossed on off, blocked to cover on the front foot
full on off, stretches out and smothers it
pushed through on off stump, flatter, swept hard between deep midwicket and long leg
fired on off, presses forward and defends it back to Jadeja
slid through on off, Mendis crunches another sweep to deep midwicket
slides in on off, defended to midwicket
worked with the spin through square leg off the back foot
short offbreak, starts outside off and finishes on off, whipped to midwicket
short again, worked with the spin to deep square
turn again, of the slow variety, but the length is shorter, allowing Dimuth to punch to point off the back foot
slides on off, defended to silly point
Ashwin lands it on off, twirls away, ignored
carrom ball, swerves into Dimuth, he camps back and hurriedly clips it to midwicket
slides in on off, the extra bounce takes the glove, drops onto the pitch
tucked around the corner for a single
Dimuth skips out, Jadeja darts it on leg. Dimuth isn't close to the pitch and jabs it to midwicket
good length, Dimuth steps out, Jadeja deceives him in flight and hits the pad
clipped away through backward square leg
really full and wide outside off, Mendis opens the face to find the gap to the left of cover. Drilled away
very full and holds its line outside off, Dimith closes the face and drives it down to mid-on
length and outside off, Dimuth presses forward, drives on the up to short cover
Shami searching for reverse. He runs in with the ball in his left hand before transferring it late. Back of a length and this holds its line outside off, left alone
back of a length on off, defended

this a beauty from Shami! He ventures wide of the crease, angles it in, and gets it to straighten away. Dimuth, who had been playing inside the line all this while, reaches out with his hands and watches the ball snake past the outside edge
on a length and outside off, left alone
tossed up on off, Mendis presses forward, this turns to take the outside edge. It rolls past slip
Mendis gets forward and drives this length ball on the up to short cover
Jadeja gets it to burst from the deck outside off, bounces over the sweep
very full and slid in on the legs, clipped away through midwicket
skids into off stump, blocked off the back foot
wide of the crease, slanted in outside off, Mendis pats it down
back of a length on top of off, defended
good length on off, punched down to mid-on
full and pushed through in the channel, left alone
back of a length and on off again, blocked off the front foot
just short of a good length and tails to rap the thigh as Mendis was playing across the line and missing. It would have bounced over
faster and turns in, defended to short leg
Dimuth uses his feet and flicks to square leg
reverse-swept from the stumps to backward point. Not middled
pushed through on off, turns away and bounces over the sweep
round-arm slider, dead-batted on middle
really full on off stump, Mendis still loads up for another sweep. It was faster from Jadeja as well, but Mendis smashes it to the midwicket boundary. Fetch that!
wide of the crease, angled into leg stump, defended to square leg
wide of the crease, chest-high short ball on middle, Dimuth hops up and deflects it to long leg
shorter and outside off, Mendis rises on top of the bounce and plays a jabbing punch to cover
back of a length on off from over the wicket, clipped away to long leg
full and angled in on middle, pushed to mid-on
back of a length and holds its line outside off, no shot. That's drinks
there's that flat, hard sweep again. Mendis fetches it from outside off and smacks it to deep midwicket

big shout for caught behind, umpire Oxenford does not budge. Kohli calls for a review. Short and spinning down the leg side, Dimuth is cramped for room. There's a noise. Not off the glove. Kisses the outside of the thigh and Saha pouches it
flatter and fired on off, whipped hurriedly to midwicket
flatter, pitches outside off, and finishes on middle, reverse-swept firmly through cover point
shortish on the stumps, punched down the ground

It's only fitting he sails to his hundred with a smashin' sweep. What an innings from Mendis! Reminds you of Chandimal's wildfire century in Galle two years ago. Pushed through on quicker off and middle, Mendis stretches out and hammers it through square leg. Dismissive. Mendis removes the helmet and thumps his chest with the bat, soaks it all in, and celebrates. He reaches the landmark off just 120 balls. Kohli applauds his effort
full and outside off, defended
good length on off, presses forward in defence
shorter and rising on off, Dimuth rises with it and pats it down hastily
pitched up and outside off, forward and driven to short cover
short of a length and outside off, leans back, rides the bounce, and cuts to third man
very full and angling in on off, 123ks, shuffles across and blocks to short midwicket
flighted and just outside off, presses forward and drives to cover
floated down leg, beats the attempted glance
looped up on middle, negotiated with a straight bat
another non-turner on middle, dead-batted
tossed up on middle, defended back with a dead-straight bat
slow, short, wide outside off. Dimuth has all the time in the world to rock back and merrily cut it away to the sweeper cover boundary
Pandya bangs it into the middle of the deck, this sails over the ducking batsman to the keeper. Too high, and that's a wide
short and angled into the body, fended off behind square
floated full on off, pushed back to Pandya
short and wide outside off, delays the cut and sends the ball to third man
short and angled in on off, helped away with the angle to long leg
full on middle, played back to the bowler
off-stump yorker from around the wicket, dug out to leg
pushed through on middle, Mendis goes low, gets on top of the ball, and drills another sweep, this is placed to long leg
full on middle, defended to leg on the front foot
Dimuth steps out, gets too close to the pitch, and whips from leg stump to midwicket
fired full on middle, driven down to mid-off
floated up outside off, presses forward and drives the ball to cover
slow turn, Dimuth waits and dabs it late to slip
wide of the crease, back of a length and angled in on middle, defended to the straighter of the two short midwickets
leg-stump ball, duly glanced to long leg
short and wide outside off, Dimuth has a leaden-footed slash... and misses
back of a length on middle, worked to short midwicket off the back foot
short and outside off, no shot
yorker, tails in on off, dug out
pushed full and outside off, Mendis stretches out and drives it down to long-on
looped up on middle, no turn, pushed back off the front foot
back of a length and outside off, defended to silly point off the back foot
looped up on middle, backs away outside leg and drives it to short cover
full and straight, driven to the right of mid-on for one
carrom ball on middle, Mendis stretches out to defend it
good length and outside off, curves away late, after the batsman had left it
jumps from a length outside off, stabbed to point. Hardik's front-foot strays
full and wider than a set of stumps outside off, left alone
back of a length on off, punched crisply to mid-off
on a length and very wide outside off, Dimuth does not go after it
full on off, looks like the slower ball, Dimuth presses forward to defend
follows the slower one with a rapid short ball, angled back in from around the wicket, leaves Dimuth in a tangle and is is rapped on the back thigh. This 138ks ball nearly floored Dimuth
This stand is now >SL's first-innings score. Back of a length and outside off, this keeps low, Mendis goes low with it and jabs the ball to cover
Dimuth stands up tall to this short ball outside off and solidly punches to short cover
short and angled into the hips, Dimuth is super strong there, clipped away through square leg
good length and angling in on middle, patted to mid-on
short and angled in on off, Dimuth's bat twists in his hands as he squeezes an inside edge to midwicket
yorker, tails in at off, dug out
low full-toss floated very wide outside off, Mendis stretches out and laces a square drive. Strays in line and length. Hardik's front foot has strayed as well
bouncer on middle, ducks under it
wide of the crease, slower ball, kicks up at the batsman. Offcutter, 117.4ks. Blocked solidly
pitched up on off, defended stoutly
short and angled in on off, Mendis gets right behind the line in defence

Has Hardik produced a wicket outta nowhere? Appeal for caught behind, minutes before stumps. Did it carry to the keeper? The soft signal is out. Saha dives forward to snag a clean catch. Gets his gloves underneath the ball and ends Mendis' incredible innings. India have been forced to dig deep into their reserves for this wicket. Hardik sends down an offcutter. It's a proper offbreak, in fact, 123.7ks, swerves in, Mendis does not read the variation. He pushes out and only manages an inside edge onto the pad. The ball balloons behind to a sprawling Saha. Great catch to end a great innings!
near yorker wide outside off, Pushpakumara squeezes it out

tossed up and spins into leg stump, Kohli pre-meditates and moves to his right at leg slip. Had he not done that, he would have been in a position to catch this ball. Dimuth glances it away to the fine leg boundary
full on middle, defended
skids into leg stump, defended to short leg
spins in, lobs off the pad to short leg
looped up on off, presses forward and defends stoutly
tossed up generously outside off, Pushpakumara stretches out and blocks
tossed up higher and slower, gloves it onto the thigh pad
good length on off, defended back
flighted and spinning down leg, left alone
tucked off the pads around the corner
slides through outside off, turns and bounces past the groping bat
good length and breaks away outside off, beaten again
length ball, bounces big outside off, Malinda pulls his bat inside the line
pushed through outside off, the length is full, and draws him into a drive. Beats the outside edge again
short and some width outside off, Dimuth jumps onto it, gets on top of the bounce and unfurls a serene square cut
full, starts on off, grips, and turns past the outside edge. The dip also ensured the batsman can't meet the pitch
fuller and pushed through on middle, blocked to cover
lobbed up on off, Dimuth presses forward, short stride, and defends to silly point
really full on middle, driven back to the bowler
floated up full on leg stump, blocked back down the pitch
Malinda tucks his bat inside the line and does well. Tossed up wide outside off and turns away
similar ball, and Malinda pulls his bat inside the line again
tossed on off, presses forward and defends
starts on off stump, and spins viciously outside off, Malinda keeps his bat inside the line again
flatter and spins away, grazes the outside edge but does not carry to slips
arm ball from Jadeja, fizzes in and nearly shaves the off stump as Malinda lets it go again
good length, ventures wide of the crease, Shami angles it in, heading towards middle, Dimuth stops it in its tracks
much fuller and on a fourth-stump line, this straightens so very late. Dimuth is late to pull his bat inside the line. Beaten. Terrific ball from Shami.
full and holds its line outside off, easier leave for Dimuth
137ks, short ball, slammed just outside off, Dimuth is up on his toes, jabbing at it, as the ball whistles past him again. Excellent carry to Saha, who takes it in front of his chest
fuller and holds its line in the channel again, Dimuth tightens up and lets it go
nice and full outside off, encourages Dimuth to drive. He obliges, pressing forward and stroking the ball to extra cover
plants a tossed up delivery outside off, the nightwatchman ignores it
fancies a drive on the up - which is akin to slamming your head into a brick wall on this pitch - and after a puff of dust the ball wanders to point
goes for the cut this time, as Jadeja goes shortish and quick, looking to tacking off stump into the ground. Play and miss
loops it up on leg stump, nudges past his pads <
ripping turn and it leaves the outside edge a whole pin code behind
presses forward, gets low and smothers the ball around about off stump. Good batting, Pushpakumara
first runs for the overnight opener, punching a shortish delivery behind point
pristine offdrive from Pushpakumara, long stride forward, languid flow of the arms. The spirit of a No. 3 batsman flows through Sri Lanka's nightwatchman
and now bloody-minded defence to a ball hunting down his middle stump
spots the line of the bouncer to be just wide enough outside off and drops his wrists. Good technique.
straying onto the pads and Pushpakumara, try as he might to flick it, can't do so and has to offer a leg bye to long leg to his team as penance
steps forward with a firm and straight bat as Shami hits a good length outside off from around the wicket
lunges forward, bat close to pad, and just in front of it so he can deal with the slider if need be. Good defence
good length, on off stump, blocks firmly
a little flight, a little slog but it doesn't go in the air. Pushpakumara gets across to the other end with a single to mid-on
punches through point and there is a ready single there with only squarish short third man around
between slip and gully. Pushpakumara has dilly-dallied with an open faced bat and the outside edge slides past Kohli's left at gully. The captain got up off his crouch a touch too early.
launches it over mid-on! That's the shot he was looking for earlier in the over, only this time, he has the room to free the arms better. Picks it up on the half-volley and smashes it

a pitched up delivery, now from over the wicket, draws the drive on the up from Karunaratne. He's into the shot a touch too early though - like a nervous intern on his first day at the job - and the ball wanders to midwicket
defends a shortish delivery on and around off stump

another rip-roaring delivery and Shami gets the double tea pot going because this too beats the outside edge. To make the ball in its 65th over seam away after hitting the deck like that requires Shami-loads of talent
slower ball, the batsman picks it and gently deflects it towards midwicket
short ball, from around the wicket, Pushpakumara blunts it before it can do too much damage. Especially with short leg lurking
now the full one, looking for the stumps, but Pushpakumara clips it to midwicket. Excellent. This is a fight.
turn and bounce and Karunaratne, trying a flick, can't quite reach that far
pushes it down the ground, and Jadeja hares across to his left to stop any runs
tosses it up well outside off, Karunaratne tries a sweep, but his reach isn't quite as big as that. Wanders off the pad to slip

dropped by Rahul at short leg, and it came straight to him too. Tough position to field at, but considering he is there to take such chances - with Karunaratne reaching for a good length ball to flick - he'd be rather disappointed
pushes it down the ground past the bowler's left
a token block, although he's hiding the bat away on middle stump, covering himself for the slider coming on with the arm, whereas the ball turns towards slip
plays late, plays well, continues to frustrate Shami with that broad, deadpan face (and bat)
pushes to a wide-mid on with Shami going back around the wicket
watches a back of a length delivery in the way a con man would his next mark, but lets him go. Another time.
wide delivery again, perhaps testing Karunaratne's patience in the nineties. Result: A+
short ball on off stump, Karunaratne gets under it

that's his hundred! Fourth in the second innings, sixth overall, and among the very best on such a rank turner. Gets to the mark with a sedate on-drive - that's how he's been all innings as balls kept racing past his edges like teenage drivers - and celebrates with a big smile as the ground and his team-mates stand up
he would have had to climb a skyscraper to have put bat to this one! So much bounce off a good length. Pushpakumara does well not to follow it and Saha does sensationally to take it
another that beats the bat, by about six feet vertically. This one pitched further up, bringing the batsman forward, making him play and leaving him behind
spears it into the toes, Pushpakumara digs it out
hides the bat and pad away from the line of a good length ball spinning past him
attempts a cut, but he's beaten. Pushpakumara doesn't care. He's just happy he didn't nick it. Good attitude
presses forward and blocks, expecting the slider and getting it, at 97 kph
snorter first up, pitching on a good length, and taking the elevator to the shoulder of the wicketkeeper. Karunarante has to put that behind him
shimmies down and drives to mid-off, getting to the pitch of the tossed up delivery
draws the drive out with his flight and drift onto middle stump, outside edge wanders past silly point's right
gets down to sweep a tossed up delivery outside off past straight midwicket
nudges a fuller delivery on his pads to deep square leg
shapes to cut, waiting on his back foot, but the turn makes him check his shot. Since it is slow turn, he is able to check his shot
good length ball on off stump, defends
well done, as he takes a good length ball outside off and sweeps right on top of it.
zips past the outside edge as one of the close-in fielders says 'aayega' [wicket will come]
sweeps him away, risky shot, considering the bounce on this pitch, but the line was outside leg stump, and Pushpakumara took the requisite care to get his wrists on top of the ball. Super batting
another good length ball that darts past the outside edge.
this is quicker, pitching on leg stump, and searching for middle. Pushpakumara swept a similar ball away, but this one's too quick for such indulgences
tosses it up outside off, dab sweep to fine leg
comes forward to try and block, but the offbreak takes a bit of the surface with it on its way to striking Pushpakumara on his chest
presses forward to block at a flighted delivery outside off

appeal for a bat-pad catch, but the turn is fairly sharp and it beats the inside edge handsomely while Pushpakumara is defending. He's batting so well. Playing close to his body, playing late, and with soft, soft hands
goes for the sweep, and it lobs up to leg gully, who moves back, tracking the ball.
goes back to a good length ball that spits up from outside off. Pushpakumara tries to block, but the turn beats him, lobs off his thighs to short leg
Dimuth dances down the track, is beaten in flight, so checks his flick and chips it in front of short midwicket
Dimuth stretches out, takes this turning ball from off, sweeps with the turn to fine leg. Rolled his wrists and controlled it superbly
97ks, arm ball accompanied by extra bounce, fizzes in on off stump, Malinda angles it to slips
slides in quicker on off again, presses forward and smothers it
hint of turn for Jadeja, on a length, Malinda capably defends
fuller and faster on off stump, non-turner, Malinda jabs his bat down and keeps it out
tossed up outside off, drifts in and turns a touch, Dimuth does not reach out for the ball. Plays with soft hands, and it does not carry to slip

Oh Malinda, what was that? A coach will rip his hair out looking at this. He pre-meditates a reverse swat or rather a reverse slog. Malinda shapes for the fatal hit and shows his ace early, way before Ashwin delivered the ball. The bowler spotted it, fired it flatter and quicker and hit the leg stump. Why abandon the defence when it's your strength? Only Malinda knows why he did that. It looked very, very ugly, that reverse - one of the genuine contenders for the worst shot ever
slower offbreak, turns in, catches the thigh pad. Turn and bounce

edged past the right of a diving Rahane at slip. Cracking Carrom ball, Chandimal does not pick the variation. This drifts in on middle, curves away. Squares up Chandimal, grazes the outside edge and, streaks away. He was aiming a leg-side shot and got away
pushed through on middle
slower through the air, defended with the spin
tossed up outside off, Dimuth aims a sweep but does not make contact
pushed through just outside off, Dimuth presses forward and drives to short midwicket
picked off the pads to deep square leg
length ball, slides in on off, defended back

edged again and this carries to Rahane at first slip! Jadeja is more relieved than pumped. It's Kohli who's pumped. On a good length, this slides in from around the wicket and turns away outside off. Chandimal presses forward and unwisely jabs at the ball with hard hands. Rahane dives to his right to snaffle this low catch. Excellent grab
ripping turn and bounce! Darted in from wide of the crease, jumps from a length and breaks away past the bat, opening up Mathews. It wasn't too far away from the off stump
tossed outside off, left alone
low full-toss outside off, Ashwin errs in length and Dimuth capitalises, stretches out and middles a sweep to the midwicket boundary
short and slides into the hips, worked around the corner
pushed through outside off, Mathews forgets his first ball. Brings out the sweep and hammers it to deep midwicket
floated up outside off, turns away further, Dimuth reaches out with his hands and is beaten
short and darted into the pads, back-foot punch through midwicket
meets a full dart under his eyes and clips it to midwicket
shapes for the sweep, perhaps, with the line wider outside off. But the trajectory is flatter and so he only has the time to play with a straight bat
the back leg saves him! Ooof. That was close. An ill-advised reverse sweep, to a quick, flat, good length ball outside off, takes the bottom edge and deflects off his body towards safety
nudges a shortish delivery towards short leg
flits past the batsman like he was simply a prop in front of the stumps
sweeps to long leg and retains strike. That's drinks as well
drifts in on off, Dimuth has to play, breaks away, takes the outside edge, drops wide of slip
Mathews steps down the track, Ashwin pulls his length back, hit to long-on
looped up on middle, driven on the front foot to mid-off
tossed-up offbreak, Mathews stretches out for a sweep but the extra bounce defeats him and hits him on the chest
pushed through on off, presses forward and blocks it
short starts outside off and spins in, defended with soft hands to short leg
round-arm slider, speared on middle, defended on the front foot
slides in on middle again, nearly 100ks, played back to Jadeja
good length and skids in on middle again, Mathews keeps it out
Jadeja keeps attacking the stumps, Mathews keeps protecting it
pushed through fuller on middle, Mathews stretches out, gets on top of the ball and hammers a sweep over square leg
floated up and turns away outside off, Dimuth stretches out, meets the pitch of this very full ball and square-drives it to deep point
Mathews uses his feet but is nowhere close to the pitch of this offbreak, pads up to it in the end
shuffles across and blocks this full ball on off to short midwicket
flighted and wide outside off, Mathews brings out the flat, hard sweep again. This is sent along the ground to deep midwicket
short and outside off, leans back and slaps it behind point
tossed up and bounces outside off, Mathews does not connect well enough with a sweep. But the top edge does not carry to long leg
flighted on middle, Mathews stretches out, gets under this full ball and launches it straight down the ground. High and mighty

even better from Mathews! First six of the innings in the 80th over. Not as full as the previous ball, the line is outside off, Mathews manufactures a bit of room, hits it with the turn over the top of mid-off. Gorgeous flow of the arms
starts outside off, faster and turns big past the bat
speared outside off, spins and bounces, wafts to point
short and wide outside off, cracked off the back foot to backward point
slides on outside off, does not come back in to threaten off, left alone
skids on outside off, faster one, blocked to cover off the back foot
leg-stump half-volley, Dimuth presses forward and eases it between midwicket and mid-on
slides in from around the wicket, Dimuth has a small stride as he inside-edges it onto the pad
looped up on off, Dimuth is now right forward to smother it
Dimuth skips out, but is beaten in flight, this drifts in and he squeezes an inside edge onto the front pad
drifting down leg, beats Dimuth's glance, and Saha as well. The ball trickles away to the fine leg boundary for four leg byes
length and outside off, Mathews reaches out for the ball and creams it to cover
flighted on off stump, stretches forward and smothers it
drifts in towards leg stump, tapped through square leg with gentle hands
skids into the pads, non-turner, picked off through backward square leg
tossed up on middle, dead batted
slides in on off, Mathews presses forward and defends it to cover
he finds movement right away! Good length, angling away, seaming away outside off, whistles past the outside edge. Encouraging carry to the keeper
a bit too full on middle, 138ks, Dimuth moves forward and smoothly drives the ball to mid-off
back of a length on off, presses forward and defends it back
short and outside off, seams away, Dimuth gets on his tippy toes and runs it to backward point
full and nibbles in on off, worked to midwicket
straying into the hips, tucked away to long leg
full and holds its line just a shade outside off, Dimuth presses forward and drives fluently but straight to mid-off
back of a length and skids back in, Dimuth sits back, his bat comes down at an angle. He is smacked on the thigh
full and veers in on off, jabbed to midwicket
tight line on off, presses forward and blocks it solidly
short and width outside off, Dimuth leans back and crisply cuts it to sweeper cover
back of a length and angled in on off, Dimuth gets right behind the line in defence
short and rises outside off, Mathews rises with it and taps it down
full and veering into the pads, picked off to deep square leg
lovely bowling from Umesh. Good length, angled in around off, forces Mathews to play, but it seams away, claims the edge but it does not carry to Rahane at gully
full on middle, patted down to mid-on
an appeal for lbw, umpire Tucker shoots it down quickly. This was just short of a good length and angled in, pings the thigh pad. Bouncing over. Ultra Edge detects an inside edge
length and angled in, close to the off stump, tight leave from Mathews
full on middle, played back down the pitch
wide of the crease, bouncer, angled in on leg stump, Dimuth comfortably ducks under it
half-volley outside off, Dimuth laps up the scoring opportunity. He leans into it and creams a drive between mid-off and cover. Ashwin dives to his right from mid-off in vain
shorter and wider outside off, predictably so, Dimuth rocks back and cuts it to deep point
full and outside off, left alone
banged in short on off, Mathews jumps off the ground, fends to cover, and scurries to the other end
just short of a good length and angled in on off, hops, skips, and defends
really full on off, driven firmly to mid-off off the front foot
full and angled in, defended back to the bowler
short and angled in on leg stump, Mathews jumps and directs the ball to long leg
shortish and angling away outside off, Dimuth reaches out for the ball with his hands and jabs it through cover point

Umesh hits the bat hard and finds the edge, but it does not carry to Rahane at gully. Back of a length, bounces and seams away outside off, takes the outside edge near the higher part of the bat. Top bowling from Umesh
spins in from just outside off, defended
shorter and outside off, punched back
faster one, turns in on off, pushed to cover
Dimuth uses his feet and pats a full ball to short midwicket
tossed outside off, presses forward and dabs wide of slip
shorter and skids back in, blocked to leg off the back foot
full and angled in on off, driven past the right of mid-on
short and curves away outside off, opens the face and steers it to third man
short and outside off, Mathews stands tall and handsomely punches to sweeper
clipped off the pads through square leg
back of a length and angled in on of, defended back
short, gets on top of the short ball outside off and flays it away to deep backward point
tossed up and turns away outside off, Mathews dares to drive on the up, squirts an outside edge to point
stretches out and defends this length ball to silly point
slides in around off and screams away with extra bounce. Mathews did well to just play inside the line
picked off the pads to long leg. Sri Lanka reach 300 for the first time this series
pushed through flatter on the leg stump, off the pad to leg slip
stump-to-stump line, defended back
tossed outside off, Mathews stretches out for a big sweep but does not make contact
Mathews uses his feet, gets too close to the pitch of this full ball on off, squeezes a single to cover
drifts in from around the wicket, the length is nice and full, Dimuth plays across the line and leading-edges it. It drops to the left of Rahane at first slip. Does not carry
Ashwin flicks out the carrom ball, curves away, Mathews jabs it down
follows the carrom ball with a turning, bouncing offbreak, lobs over leg slip off the thigh

flicks out another carrom ball, extracts extra bounce, the length is full and the line is on off. Mathews can't leave it. He looks to defend, Ashwin takes the outside edge near the higher part of the bat, but the ball evades slip. Probing over to cap the morning session
flicks it through to deep square leg
spots the full and wide delivery and lays his bat down like a ramp for it to deflect over to square leg
defends a good length ball on off stump
gets down the pitch to a fuller, quicker delivery on middle, trying to work it into the leg side. Doesn't connect and weathers an lbw appeal from Jadeja
nudges a full delivery on leg stump to midwicket
picks the shortish length, rocks back and whips the ball from off stump to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, defends
naaaiice. It's the cutter - the one that got the other centurion of this innings - but Karunarante realises it's wide of off stump and avoids it
another cutter and it takes off! Having moved around the wicket, he makes Karunaratne play at a back of a length delivery outside off stump. The change in angle nearly does him in
full on middle and leg, at 140 kph, Karunaratne clips it to deep square leg
seems to be the slower one again, Mathews tries to deflect it to fine leg, but he's hit on the pads instead
the wide cutter now, seeing if Mathews fancies reaching for it. He does, but rolls his wrists on top of the ball. Necessary precaution on this pitch
loops it up on middle, from over the wicket, Karunaratne keeps it down while sending it to short leg
works it off his pads past leg gully's right
defends a full, quick ball on middle
clips a flatter delivery well outside leg through to deep square leg
blocks the progress of the arm ball head-hunting the middle stump
presses forward to block on middle
blocks, with the open face, a shortish delivery outside off
there's the offcutter again, pitching on a good length, outside off. Karunaratne lets it pass
waits and waits to see if this good length ball will threaten his stumps - it does - and so with the quick hands you'd expect from a batsman batting past hundred, he deals with it
works the angle into him from around the wicket as he flicks through to deep square leg
half an appeal for lbw, because Mathews moves right across in front of the stumps to take the offcutter flush in the space between the pad and the thigh pad. That hurt
shapes for the cut because of the length behind short, but since it is the offcutter, it bites into the pitch and comes off the pitch a lot slower. Mathews adjusts and dabs through cover
wants the sweep, seeing the line outside off, but Jadeja's too quick and it can only be dealt with a straight bat
props himself up right in front of the stumps like a hockey goalkeeper and clips the short ball behind square leg
comes down the track for a clip through midwicket, but he can't get bat to it

takes off like a rocket and even Karunaratne is unable to best it. A perfectly good length ball on middle suddenly becomes the stuff of NASA's dreams as it soars up, takes the batsman's gloves and settles safely in the hands of Rahane, having run a little way behind the wicketkeeper. Cruel end to an innings of great quality, and that qualifty is reinforced by the fact most of India's close-in fielders run over to Karunaratne to shake his hand and his team-mate Mathews runs up to shake his hand before he leaves
races down the pitch straight away to block a full delivery fired in on middle
nudges a good length ball between short leg and leg gully
shifts back in front of off stump to defend a shortish offcutter. Goes off the toe-end towards backward short leg

another one that bites into the pitch. Pandya's lining these offcutters well - this one right on middle, making Mathews play. He does it well enough, pulling the bottom hand off the handle to ensure the ball goes straight down
pushes at a fuller delivery outside off, but checks his shot so that it goes to short cover on the bounce. Pandya chirps at Dickwella, who just smiles back
another offcutter, wide outside off, Dickwella first trusses up all of his natural instincts and then comes back to ignores it
flirts with a back of a length delivery outside off, and is beaten
defends a back of a length delivery to the left of gully
dcarves it past point's right. There's dreadful risk driving on the up on this pitch that's throwing up puffs of dust by the dozen
shapes to cut at a short ball, but it turns too far past him. Wriddhiman Saha does excellently to stay low enough to collect it

caught behind! Saha has been legendary behind the stumps, and he establishes that fact with this catch. Mathews is playing a cut. A full-blooded cut. And he gets a top-edge. A sizeable top edge. But Saha is right there, climbing with the ball, eyes on it. His hands move up high over his shoulder and the ball sticks in the edge of his gloves. Superb work.
blocks a full delivery on middle and off
keeps out a pitched up delivery on middle

dropped - only because he got a hand to it. Really tough chance, and it ends up on the conscience of Kohli at gully. Jadeja lures the batsman into an on-the-up drive and Perera obliges. The ball comes off the edge, has decent pace behind it, he he has very little time to react. Gets one hand to it, but the problem perhaps is his first step, moving to his right.
fuller delivery on middle and off, Dickwella defends inside the line, gets a little leading edge as the cutter deviates off the pitch
defends a fuller ball on middle
slower ball, beds into the pitch and comes up so reluctantly. Perera deals with it like most parents do with their kids at 9 am
bangs it in short - that's his happy place, it won't quite stay the same if he realises he has just given the batsman an easy leave
covers the off stump well and leaves outside it. Good work, Perera
sweeps the length ball on leg stump, regardless of the dust erupting from the pitch like my father's temper when he catches me in the liquor cabinet
defends a full delivery just outside off

that's not on! If you have to step down the track to Jadeja, you don't do it early. Perera learns the lesson in the hardest way possible as he leaves the crease, gets a quick, ripping delivery that beats his outside edge by a mile and goes to the waiting Saha who is perfectly brilliant
slides in flatter and quicker, Dhananjaya has a short stride and defends
slides in from around the wicket, darted on off and bursts past the bat. The batsman did well not to jab at the ball. You can play inside the line. That's all you can do
another flat dart from the Jadeja pop gun, this lands on off, Dhananjaya squeezes it out
full and attached with width outside off, Dickwella backs away outside leg. No half measures. He swishes it over the top of the cordon
back of a length and angled in on off, no violence here. Dickwella simply covers up the line
pitched up on off, draws  Dickwella forward to a push to cover. It was a slower one and Dickwella checked his shot
offcutter, yorker length, raises a puff of dust, Dickwella ventures deep in the crease and keeps it out
full and wobbles through outside off, Dickwella, for a change, does not go after it
full and angled in on off stump, Dickwella chooses to play back and drives it without much power to mid-on
speared in on middle, really full, no, can't sweep off that length. He jams an inside edge onto the pad
belted away to the midwicket boundary! Pushed through outside off - not as full as the previous ball. De Silva stretches out and succeeds in sweeping it flat and hard. De Silva avoids a pair
shorter and outside off, chopped over slips
Dickwella dances out, does not meet the pitch, checks his shot and chips to midwicket
slides on and bounces on leg stump, a sweep-happy Dickwella sends a top-edge that lands in front of long leg
fizzes in just outside off and turns away, De Silva lets it go
short, Pandya hits the deck hard, Dickwella defends it on off
good length and this is floated through outside off, no shot
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and punches to short point, Pujara under the helmet
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Dickwella has a naughty flirt.... and misses
floated wider than a set of stumps outside off, Dickwella lets it go
pitched up on a fourth-stump line, Dickwella stays leg-side of the ball as he cracks it to short point
pushed through on off, the sweep is the kryptonite for these super spinners. De Silva brings it out and crashes it to the square boundary
darted shorter and wide outside off, De Silva rocks back and cuts it firmly through point. Good luck stopping that
tossed up on the leg stump or just outside off, brings out another variety - the lap-sweep and sends it fine on the leg side - to make it a hat-trick of fours
slid through outside off, bounces, no shot
round-arm slider outside off, no shot again
another flat, round-arm fizzer, De Silva presses out and inside-edges it onto the pad

good length and wide outside off, holds its line as opposed to angling in. Stops on the batsman as well. Dickwella jabs at it but does not carry to the close-in catchers behind square - wide slip and a pair of gullies
back of a length and outside off, Dickwella camps back and guides it to wide slip
Dickwella shuffles across off even before Pandya delivers, exposes leg and middle stumps. Pandya looks to shatter it. Slings it further down leg instead
short and wide outside off, slapped onto the ground, can't beat gully, however. Rahane falls to his right to stop the ball
slower cutter outside off, 111ks, Dickwella spots the change-up and lets it pass
back of a length and skids in, heading towards the top of off, Dickwella's jabbing bat intervenes. That's drinks
slower outside off, turns away, and bounces, De Silva eyes up a sweep, gets a top edge that drops into where silly point may have been
short and bounces outside off, beats the cut
pushed through on the stumps, defended

Has Rahane pocketed another low catch? The TV umpire has been called in. The soft signal from on-field umpire Oxenford is out. Brushes the glove and dies on Rahane. He bends low with it at slip. Umpire Illingworth says 'seems like he has his hands underneath the ball'. Yes, Rahane has his hands nice and low, and that's where the ball landed. Flat dart from Jadeja, slides in outside off, turns slightly and bounces sharply. Great grab from Rahane, and another five-wicket haul for Jadeja
skids on to rap the pad but the impact may have been outside off. India choose not to review
skids on just outside off, reverse-swatted away to deep square leg
opens the face and runs it through point
low full-toss on off, bunted to mid-off
full, angled in from around the wicket, and takes off outside off. Saha soars with it and takes it
Herath looks to sweep hard from outside off, short leg intercepts the ball
looped up slower and higher outside off, beats the sweep
slid in from around the wicket, beats him on the sweep again and hits the shoulder with bounce
pushed through on the leg stump, Dickwella reverses it away wide of deep point
Dickwella thrusts his front leg outside the line of off as he aims another reverse-sweep, but is hit on the pad now
gets his front leg outside the line again, reverse-sweeps from the stumps to Ashwin at deep point this time
Herath aims a reverse-sweep of his own. This is hurled on middle and spinning down leg. The noise came from the bat jamming the ground
slider, round-arm, kept out
looped up slower on off stump, Herath presses forward to smother it
reverse-sweeps galore. Struck from middle stump to deep backward point
tossed up and drifts in to catch the thigh
pushed outside leg, ripe for the sweep, Herath goes low and directs it to the right of leg slip, rolling his wrists on top of the ball
slides in on off, Herath drops the ball beside his feet
tossed up slower and higher outside off, carrom ball. Herath reaches out for the ball with his hands and crunnnnhes a slog-sweep over midwicket
pushed through on middle, Herath reverses it flat and hard behind point
pushed through on off, defended
bounces, spins from outside off, misses the reverse and is hit on the pad
uses his feet and clips a length ball to midwicket
breaks in from outside off, hits the pad again does Jadeja
tossed up on leg stump, Dickwella goes low, rolls his wrists, and controls a sweep to fine leg
Jadeja roars an appeal for leg-before. The impact looks outside the line of off. Kohli decides against a review. This one slides in to beat the inside edge but the impact was the issue
Thumped to the long-on boundary. Gallops down the track, meets it on a half-volley, and drills it down the ground from a middle-stump line
Dickwella pre-meditates a reverse, tossed wider outside off, stroked to third man
tossed up full on middle, lap-swept away to fine leg now
good length, spins in, and breaks past the outside edge
dropped shorter and outside off, opens the face and helps it to deep third man
slower through the air on middle, reverse-sweep. What else? Guided to third man
clattered away to the midwicket boundary! Good length and angled in outside off from wide of the crease, Dickwella had shuffled across off, using the angle to smack it to the ropes
Dickwella shuffles outside leg now, Pandya follows him with a full ball, which is driven down the ground
pretty full and veers in on leg stump as Herath plays all around his front pad, but this was heading down leg
bouncer on middle, flies over a ducking Herath to Saha
very full and slanted in on middle, Herath stylishly whips it away through square leg one foot in the air
slower offcutter, 119ks, but the length is short, allowing Dickwella to dab it to slip with soft hands
starts outside off and turns to beat Herath and hit him on the pad
darted down the leg side, bounces out of the rough and beats the glance
full on middle, presses forward and defends it
tossed up outside off, Herath stretches out and slog-sweeps it in the air. Jadeja races in from deep midwicket but the ball dies in front of him
looped up and bursts out of the rough outside leg. Herath shapes to reverse-sweep. The ball lobs off the shoulder to Saha behind the stumps
113ks slower offcutter outside off, Herath loads up for a biiiiig slog but is beaten by the change of pace. He was too early into the hoick
full and angling into the pads, tucked away to the left of the square leg umpire
length-ball offcutter outside off, jumps from the deck, Dickwella has a naughty flirt and misses it in the channel
slower ball with a proper offbreak grip. 95ks - slower than Jadeja's pace - back of a length floated outside off and moves further away. No shot from Dickwella
yet another offbreak outside off, bounces through to Saha as Dickwella lets it go again
slow, short and comes in on middle, helped away through square leg for one
floated a long way outside off, Herath steps down the track and pads up to it
tossed up outside off, rolls his wrists and sweeps it straight to Kohli at short fine leg
slid outside leg again. Dickwella unleashes a flat, hard reverse-sweep. Drilled through backward point
Ashwin keeps bowling outside leg, Sri Lanka keep sweeping. This is played to short fine leg
Dickwella jumps a long way outside leg even before Ashwin delivers. The spinners follows him and keeps the batsman to a block to cover
flighted outside off, and that's the zillionth reverse-sweep to deep point

Dickwella has jabbed this wide yorker straight into the lap of gully! Pandya ventures wide of the crease and sends it wide outside off. Dickwella angles his bat and hits it straight to Rahane. Dolly catch. He did not even have to budge this time
very full and wide outside off, fizzes into the gloves of Saha, as Pradeep flirts with his feet stapled to the crease
very full and slanted in on off, nearly 140ks, Pandya cranking up to the tail-ender. Pradeep inches forward and defends it back to him
lobs a slower offcutter on off, just 112ks, Pradeep spots the change-up and covers up the line in defence
lifter outside off, soars through to the keeper as Pradeep sinks under it. Too high, and that's a wide
yorker, swerves in on leg stump, Pradeep camps back and bunts it past the right of midwicket
full, middle-stump hunting ball, kept out
flicks out the carrom ball, drifts in from outside leg, elicits a leading edge, but does not carry to Ashwin
An appeal for lbw. Not given. India ask for a review Looks like another carrom ball. Pitches outside leg and swerves away to rap the front pad
flighted on off, opens the face and defends to cover

It's all over at the SSC. Tossed up slower and higher outside off. Pradeep - busted hamstring and all - aims a biiiig slog-sweep. He only shoots up a top-edge in the air. Dhawan, who set up the series for India with a breakneck 190, fittingly sews up the series. He settles under this skier at mid-on and slaps the thigh
